Description: A cult favourite – it usually sells out before it even hits the shop floor. A plush, smooth and supple blend that's tweaked every year.
Summer berries. Vanilla. Spain’s favourite Reserva from the name that made Rioja what it is today.

BottleName: Mt Difficulty 'Roaring Meg' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Central Otago
Description: Raspberries. Cherries. A hint of spice. This is savoury, red-fruity Pinot made with fruit from the oldest Pinot vineyards in Otago. Made to drink young.
Plush, plummy Malbec from the first Latin American winemaker to ever score 100 Parker points. We’re lucky enough to have the UK exclusive.
Spain’s wine laws are notoriously strict. The Guv'nor breaks them all. This multi-regional blend offers great value and great flavour. Bold. Fruity. Brilliant.
Portuguese red blends are a Majestic speciality, and we’ve stepped up our game with this exclusive bottling. It’s big. It’s bold. It’s fruity. You’ll love it.
An intense nose coffee, chocolate and cherry from South Africa's star grape. A real customer favourite.
Expect intense flavours of blackberry, black plum and mocha. Its firm tannins pair perfectly with roast venison and hearty game dishes.
Notes of blackberry, black pepper and oak. Try it with dumplings and a spiced yoghurt dressing.

Made in a soft, fruit-forward style, this Pinotage spends 12 months in French oak barrels to give a silky-smooth texture. It's a complex wine, with notes of raspberry, strawberry, red cherry and chocolate. Try it with a hearty beef burger.
Intense blackberry, mint and spice. Made by one of Stellenbosch's most exciting winemakers.
Big. Rich. Velvety. It’s a hug in a glass – and the very first wine ever to be made appassimento-style using Primitivo. Delicious.
It’s a Majestic classic – one of our favourite clarets. Plummy. Black fruity. Silky. Not to mention Château Méaume are sustainability pioneers.
The palate shows richness and roundness with flavours of black cherries and plums.
This appassimento Nero d’Avola is a world first. Combining Sicily’s signature red with a centuries-old winemaking method turns the flavour dial way up.
It's rich and full-bodied, with flavours of red fruits, sweet spices and pepper. Try it with a vegetable chilli.
David Finlayson earned his stripes at Château Margaux, one of the very best estates in Bordeaux.
Flavours of blackberry, red fruits and vanilla that are great with Iberian cold cuts.

BottleName: Domini Veneti 'La Casetta' Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore 2017/18
Description: Valpolicella Ripasso – with a difference. Made using leftover skins from sweet Recioto production, it’s even plusher than standard Ripasso.
Barossa Shiraz is Australia in a glass. Powerful. Flavour-packed. Full-bodied. And thanks to our buyers, this one's an absolute steal for the quality.
Big. Bold. Savoury. Packed with blueberry and cassis flavours – it’s an homage to Max Schubert, the man responsible for the iconic Penfold’s Grange.
A Tuscan classic with a Riserva depth. Notes of bramble fruit and blueberry, grounded by a remarkable structure.
Intense. Velvety. Ripe. The grapes are left to over-ripen on the vine, giving the flavours unbelievable concentration. Red-fruity with moreish spice.
Nero d’Avola was harvested in Sicily by the Ancient Greeks. They were really on to something. It’s a plush, damson and fig flavoured beast of a wine.

BottleName: Saint-Émilion Grand Cru 2016 Baron de Boutisse, Bordeaux
Description: Intense flavours of vanilla and dark fruits that are best with roast beef.

BottleName: Stag's Leap 'Hands of Time' Red Blend 2017/18, Napa Valley
Description: Your chance to taste Stag Leap's world-famous red wine at a smaller sum.
Torbreck is one of Barossa's most celebrated wineries, and the Woodcutter's Shiraz is a delicious introduction to its full-bodied arsenal.
From an award-winning bodega, this is a fruity, rich Rioja Reserva at great value. Sweetly red-fruity. Brambly. Rich.

BottleName: Castello Banfi Rosso di Montalcino DOC 2019
Description: A fresher alternative to Brunello made by an acclaimed Montalcino winery.

BottleName: Au Bon Climat Pinot Noir 'Isabelle' 2017/18 California
Description: A Burgundy-style Pinot Noir made by the pioneering Jim Clendenen. Flavours of red cherry and oak.
Previously at Cháteau Margaux, Winemaker Stephen Huse uses high-altitude vines and careful oak ageing to create a complex red that has soft tannins alongside notes of black fruit and violets.
Big. Bold. Black-fruity. It’s classic full-on and fruity Zinfandel, made by our buyers with a producer named ‘USA Producer of the Year’ five times.
This full-bodied, savoury Nebbiolo. It’s remarkably fresh, with intense notes of ripe and juicy red fruits. Rich roast lamb will balance its firm tannins perfectly.
Expect flavours of plum, blackcurrant and violets and delicate floral aromas. Try it with risotto.
The world’s first appassimento Carménère from the only commercial winery in the Elqui Valley, Chile’s most extreme wine region. Rich. Plummy. Peppery.

BottleName: La Màgia Organic Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2015/16
Description: With an excellent balance of poise and power, this Brunello has a bright palate of red berries, minerality and gentle spice.

BottleName: Castello di Meleto 'San Pietro' Chianti Classico DOCG 2019
Description: Expect complex notes of cherries, flowers and vanilla. Serve now with leg of lamb or cellar for another five years.
A structured Super Tuscan made by one of Italy's most in-demand wineries.

BottleName: Marqués de Riscal Gran Reserva Rioja 2014/15
Description: An exceptional Gran Reserva Rioja made from 80-year-old vines. Will age well for decades.
The delicate Pinot Noir grape is pampered by Pacific breezes on Chile's cool-climate Casablanca Valley.

BottleName: Definition Valpolicella Ripasso Superiore DOC 2017/18, Italy
Description: Expect aromas of cherry jam, tobacco and black pepper and silky tannins. Try it with slow-cooked beef ragù.

BottleName: Viña Errázuriz ‘Estate Series’ Merlot 2020, Valle de Curicó
Description: Soft, smooth Merlot from one of Chile's top wine estates. Red fruit, caramel and mocha.
This is a modern take on traditional Italian reds - bold, characterful and  full of flavour.''
This is bright and packed with red-berry aromas. It's smooth, fresh and incredibly drinkable. You’ll love it with meat dishes, such as ox-cheek ragù.
Produced from the Barbera grape, from vines over 40 years old, it reveals concentrated dark fruits on the nose, soft tannins and lively acidity.
The Rothschild wine legacy began with James de Rothschild at Château Lafite, one of the world's most prestigious wineries.

BottleName: MAN Family Wines 'Outentiek' Syrah 2020, South Africa
Description: A medium-bodied, peppery style of Syrah with bright red-fruit notes and polished tannins. Try it with crispy pork belly.
Thought Chile ends at good value? Think again. If you do some digging, you can find refined reds on cool-climate sites. Like the Marea.
Juicy. Red-fruity. Spicy. A moreish and delicious organic Côtes du Rhône made by our buyers with the Perrin brothers – of Château de Beaucastel fame.
Brilliant garnet in colour, with a classic Rhône nose of bramble fruits and heady spice. The medium-bodied palate has fresh and snappy red fruit surrounded by firm and persistent tannins.
The Beaujolais is stuffed with elegant red fruit flavours of raspberry and strawberry and possesses a fine refreshing acidity.
Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon grapes are vinified separately then allowed to harmonise in oak barrels to produce a soft and intensely fruity wine.
Bright ruby in colour, with an expressive nose of youthful fruits. Rich, dark cherries and liquorice on the palate and a fresh finish.
It's elegant and full-bodied, with aromas of roses, truffle, blackcurrant and cinnamon. Try it with venison stew.
Gran Reserva is the crème de la crème of Rioja. Aged for even longer than legally required for Gran Reserva – giving it spicy dried-fruit flavours.
A rich, layered Reserva only produced in excellent vintages.
It’s full of candied red fruit flavours and very smooth to drink, thanks to elegant tannins. A wine for a gourmet burger, comforting stew or chorizo-based dishes.

BottleName: Rioja Gran Reserva 2012 Marqués de Cáceres
Description: Showing great complexity with notes of roasted coffee, spice, plum and strawberry. Powerful in the mouth with fleshy fruit and nuances of toasty, well-integrated oak leading to a balanced finish.

BottleName: Château la Sauvageonne 'Grand Vin' 2018, Terrasses du Larzac Organic
Description: A robust, fleshy wine with plenty of fine-grained tannins giving weight, volume and an enduring texture.
The genius of Finca Carelio is that we use declassified wine – so you get all the quality, plus serious savings. Rich, ripe and full of black fruits. Delicious.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Bella's Garden' Shiraz 2017/18, Barossa Valley
Description: With an explosive nose of pencil lead, crushed blueberry and black cherry, it has an opaque purple colour, glorious thick texture and fantastic balance for such a big wine.
Duckhorn have quickly become one of America's star winemaking names. And it's all thanks to this iconic Napa Cabernet.
Deliciously savoury, black fruity, silky Pinot – from Marlborough, an up-and-comer in the Kiwi Pinot Noir world known for intense, dark fruity wines.
Rich, complex and award-winning. This is an Argentinian Malbec with a Bordeaux sensibility.
Ripe. Juicy. Concentrated. The grapes for BenMarco come from sites so extreme they’d never been considered for viticulture before.
Hervé Fabre was the first to make single-varietal Malbec in Mendoza. It’s the Uco Valley benchmark. Rich with dark fruit and chocolate.
A dark, richly perfumed red wine with aromas of strawberry jelly, roses, tea and orange. One to drink with barbecued ribs or lamb curry.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Angels' Share' Shiraz 2019/20, McLaren Vale
Description: Two Hands are Aussie Shiraz experts – they cherry-pick the best Shiraz grapes for their wines. Bold. Heady. Silky textured and full of jammy fruity.

BottleName: Luis Felipe Edwards Gran Reserva Merlot 2019/20, Colchagua Valley
Description: Colchagua Valley is red wine country. Fresh. Fruity. This is intensely ripe, velvety Merlot from award-winning vineyards 900 meters above sea level.

BottleName: Santa Rita ‘Medalla Real’ Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Maipo Valley
Description: Deep, ripe ruby red in colour with a nose of blackcurrant, menthol and toasty vanilla notes. Rich, ripe almost sweet tannins and a long length. Enjoy with spicy red meats, venison and goose.
Complex yet finely balanced. This famed Carménère blend has real potential for ageing.

BottleName: Château Meyney 'La Chapelle de Meyney' 2014/15, Saint-Estèphe
Description: This 92-point claret is made by Château Meyney, the only winery in Bordeaux that has clay soils similar to those at £2,500-per-bottle Pétrus.
This is bramble-laden and bold - everything a big Australian red should be. And there’s plenty of flavour for the price. Jammy black fruits, pepper and vanilla spice.
An expressive and open red, this has notes of damson jam and cassis, and that unmistakable 'garrigue' aroma of heather and wild thyme.
Almost equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Shiraz, it?s a rich, full-bodied cocktail of mocha, plum, cherry and black pepper that boasts plenty of complexity.
The velvety texture is the result of maturation - the wine is at the perfect drinking age and has fine textured tannins.
Premium and complex wine from a Chilean great. A previous vintage was featured in Decanter's Best 100 Wines in the World.
When Bob Blue began making wine, it was tough to get French oak barrels.
Eric Fabre was head winemaker at £500-per-bottle Château Lafite, but now works in the highly sought-after Languedoc enclave La Clape.

BottleName: La Belle Angèle Pinot Noir 2020, France
Description: Fine and subtle, La Belle Angèle Pinot Noir is as delicate as the artists' muse that it's named after.

BottleName: Desprat Saint Verny 'Le Tracteur Bleu' Gamay 2018, Côtes-d'Auvergne
Description: Spicy and fruity Gamay grown on volcanic soils.

BottleName: Bread and Butter Cabernet Sauvignon 2019, California
Description: A Majestic exclusive. It's aged in both French and American oak to deepen its complexity and soften the texture for an smooth sip. Expect lavish notes of vanilla and sweet spice, blackberry, cherries and chocolate. Fantastic with steak in blue-cheese sauce.
Hints of oak spice, blackcurrant and dark cherry and a fresh, elegant character.
Full-bodied, yet remarkably elegant, with notes of black fruit and plum, and fine tannins. Excellent with steak.
First-class Malbec from the first Latin American winemaker to score a perfect 100 Parker Points.
For this Reserva, we dialled up the intensity of our famous LB7. The result? A supple and moreish wine bursting with flavour.
The looming Monte Vulture may look like an intimidating place to make wine, but it hasn't erupted for thousands of years, and it's now where you'll find some of Italy's most impressive soils.
The Grenache of Italy made by one of Sardinia's most celebrated winemaking families. Intense and full-bodied, with plenty of red fruits.
Notes of wild berries, rosemary and thyme from a star British winemaker.
"Warm, velvety and floral. This delightful wine hails from one of the Uco Valley's exceptional hidden vineyards, uncovered by the acclaimed Catena Zapata family. "
A bright, polished wine with notes of red berries, vanilla and wood spice, grown from vines planted 350 metres above sea level.

BottleName: Henri de Villamont 'Les Groseilles' Chambolle-Musigny Premier Cru 2014
Description: Full-bodied yet fruity. This smooth red Burgundy comes from a legend of the Côte d'Or.

BottleName: Pardon et Fils Fleurie 2019/20, Côte des Laburons
Description: Made on one of the finest crus of Beaujolais, it has notes of red fruits and blackcurrant, a rich, silky palate and a long finish. Try this with duck.
Made with consultation from the Mitjavile family, who own renowned chateaux on Bordeaux's Right Bank, Favière is fermented in oak and aged for 18 months it's step up from its peers.
Inky, plush, high-altitude Malbec made by First Growth Château Lafite and Argentine pioneer Catena under their joint label, Bodegas Caro.

BottleName: Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Sonoma County
Description: Fruit-forward and fresh Cabernet Sauvignon from a historic Napa winery.

BottleName: Domaine la Couquihado Côtes du Rhône 2020 Magnum
Description: Notes of black cherry, plum and liquorice that are great with roast beef.
Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Plush Malbec from the first South American winemaker ever to be named ‘Decanter’s Man of the Year’, Nicolás Catena.

BottleName: Majestic Ripe and Bold 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Expect rich notes of blackberry and blackcurrant with hints of spice. Serve with barbecued beef ribs.
Red-fruit notes, smooth tannins and a spicy finish. Try it with grilled Portobello mushrooms.

BottleName: Bodegas Riojanas 'Viña Albina' Rioja Gran Reserva 2005
Description: Taste the benefits of ageing in notes of caramel and spice. It's still remarkably fruity, with vibrant notes of red fruits. Try it with roast lamb.

BottleName: Domaine Paul Jaboulet Aîné ‘La Petite Chapelle’ Hermitage 2001
Description: It's savoury and full-bodied, with notes of black pepper, leather, violet, red plum and cooked fruit. The integrated acidity makes it a fine match for grilled lamb or a tomahawk steak.
Expect aromas of strawberry, raspberry, red cherry and earth. Try this light, elegant wine with white meats.

BottleName: Château Côte de Baleau 2016, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
Description: It has fresh flavours of Morello cherry, blackberry, black plum, raspberry and sweet spices and fine tannins. Try it with roast beef.
It's silky smooth, with flavours of ripe Morello cherries and blackberries and herby aromas. Try it with grilled aubergine dishes.
This is a full-bodied and ripe Bordeaux, with flavours of blackberry, blackcurrant, red cherry and cedar. Drink now with lamb or age for ten years.

BottleName: Famille Perrin ‘Les Chemins des Mulets’ Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2019
Description: Expect flavours of raspberry and pepper. It’s the perfect partner for decadent dishes featuring game, truffles or mushrooms.

BottleName: La Combe de Vallière 'Grande Réserve' Minervois la Livinière 2018
Description: Notes of dried fruit, ripe cherries, chocolate and white pepper that are great with duck.
Plumy, jammy and ripe berry fruits augmented by hints of spice, toasted oak and chocolate aromas are followed by a rich, rounded and fruity palate with subtle oak and spices and an intense finish.
The Beaujolais is stuffed with elegant red fruit flavours of raspberry and strawberry and possesses a fine refreshing acidity.
Ripe. Fruity. This blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha showcases the best vineyards of Rioja.
A fruity blend of Shiraz, Merlot and Cabernet from an unsurpassed winemaker.
Enjoy its intense black fruit flavours, notes of tobacco, cinnamon and cloves.
It's round and powerful with well-integrated tannins and a punchy bouquet of blackberry and strawberry.

BottleName: Château de Pitray 2017, Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
Description: A deliciously smooth, round and generous wine that delivers immediate gratification." Robert Parker. Beautiful garnet-red robe with aromas of cassis fruits coupled with subtle vanilla tones.
Château Dauzac takes its second wine very seriously. Grapes are carefully picked by hand from 30-year-old vines.
You’ll find it fresh and earthy, with forest-floor, tobacco, cassis and chocolate notes. Enjoy it with roast lamb.
With a classic 'left bank' nose of smoky blackberry fruit and pencil lead the palate is rich and rounded with assertive tannins, ample fruit and well integrated oak. Perfect with beef or lamb.

BottleName: Louis Jadot 'Les Roches Rouges' Mâcon Rouge 2020
Description: An enticing nose showing subtle hints of redcurrant and raspberry, with a fruity, well-balanced palate and a fresh finish. Try with chicken.
Juicy and fresh. From one of the best negociants in Burgundy, this Pinot Noir has bags of red-fruit flavour. It’s rare to find such quality at this price.
The classic Pinot Noir nose of ripe red berries, with some darker hints of blackberry and liquorice. Lipsmacking acidity.
It's robust and full-bodied, with notes of black fruits and red cherry and herbal aromas. Try it with lamb chops.
Dense. Rich. Heady. It’s full of spice, raspberry and redcurrant. And its firm structure makes it perfect with Mediterranean-style foods, like rustic vegetable dishes.

BottleName: Perrin et Fils 'La Vieille Ferme Cuvée Majestic' 2019/20
Description: A warm, elegantly structured, spicy red with intense jammy blackberry fruits, strawberry hints and soft tannins. A great quality red and a fantastic companion for meats and cheeses.
This lush appassimento is one of our most popular Italian reds. Big. Bold. Black-fruity. It’s got a velvety texture and heady, fruit-packed flavour.
Love Amarone but don’t want to break the bank? Try this ‘baby Amarone’, made using the leftover skins from Amarone production. Supple and full bodied.
Vibrant, jammy notes of blackberry and blueberry, liquorice and spice. A brilliant match for cuts of roast beef.

BottleName: Rioja Reserva Marques de Riscal 2016 Magnum
Description: A classic Rioja Reserva. Full bodied and muscular, yet polished and embellished with complex aromas of vanilla and toasted oak, combined with summer fruit flavours. Will age for a further 5+ years.

CVNE may be one of the oldest Rioja wineries, but they’re not constrained by tradition. This is a modern, plush style of Crianza. Bright, fresh and full of red fruits. Made from a plot of thirty-year-old vines for extra complex flavour. Naturally, it’s ideal with tapas.
Think well-integrated chocolate and tobacco that join hints of black fruit and plum. Try it with a roast dinner.
A supple and silky unoaked blend. Tempranillo brings flavours of plum and cherry, while Garnacha adds creamy strawberry and spice. Outstanding with grilled peppers and chorizo.
Richly fruity with a twist of charred BBQ spice. Made from the highest quality fruit, it’s like Porta 6 but smoother, richer and even more delicious.
An intense and concentrated red fruit character forms the backbone on the nose. Refined and silky on the palate.

BottleName: Alamos Lujan De Cuyo Cabernet 2019/20, Mendoza
Description: There is lots of balckcurrant and bramble fruit flavours in the concentrated and silky wine.  The purity of fruit is enhanced by a slight woody note on the finish.
They have selected the finest grapes from this vineyard plus two others to blend this wine exclusively for us.
Delicate confected nose, with vanilla and hints of spice. A seductive palate, where dark cherries and strawberries are complemented by toasty characters and silky tannins.
Perfumed, delicate Pinot Noir, with a perfect mix of red and black fruits.
Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Plush Malbec from the first South American winemaker ever to be named ‘Decanter’s Man of the Year’, Nicolás Catena.
A generous nose of warm plum-pudding-like fruit, lifted by soft vanilla and flower petal notes. The tannins are muscular, yet smooth and voluptuous. Perfect with beef.
Gentle oak influence gifts a silkiness to a bouquet of dark plum and blackcurrants. This really is a steal at its pocket-friendly price.
Duckhorn's celebrated winemaking at a lower price.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Tenacity' Old Vine Shiraz 2020, Australia
Description: Australia has some of the oldest vines in the world – especially Shiraz vines. Rich. Ripe. Juicy. Super-concentrated black-fruity, spicey flavours.
Packed with black fruits, dark chocolate and a creamy texture, this is why the Kangarilla Road winery was given the top 'Five Red Star' rating by leading Aussie wine critic James Halliday.
Expect intense notes of blackberries, black cherry, ripe plum and black pepper. Serve with grilled lamb koftas.
A layered, ripe Cabernet Sauvignon from the winery behind The Chocolate Block.

BottleName: Jim Barry 'The Lodge Hill' Shiraz 2017/18, Clare Valley
Description: The inky blackcurrant and boysenberry fruit is lifted by violet and menthol notes, with smooth tannins still providing plenty of grip. The finish is long and rich.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Samantha's Garden' Shiraz 2018, Clare Valley
Description: Displays the typical eucalyptus notes and fineness of tannic structure that characterise Clare Valley Shiraz, enhanced by maturation for 18 months in second-fill French oak.

BottleName: Morande Reserva One to One Pais 2019
Description: Reminiscent of good Beaujolais this wine is light and fruity with red cherry and raspberry flavours followed by an earthy and spicy finish.

BottleName: Terrazas de los Andes Malbec 2018, Mendoza
Description: Harmonious and smooth, with racy notes of violet and graphite accenting the backbone of plum and currant fruit, followed by a finish reminiscent of dry cherries, raisins and prunes.
Grab a fantastic taste of Ribera del Duero with this wild and rich wine.

BottleName: Château Castegens 2016, Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
Description: Oak-aged Bordeaux from an expert winemaking family. Expect rich black-fruit flavours.
Made up predominantly of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, with a dash of Petit Verdot. It has notes of blackberry, raspberry, graphite.

BottleName: Cuvée Pierre Brun 2018/19 Domaine des Tourelles, Lebanon
Description: A blend of Cabernet, Syrah, Cinsault and Carignan, this has fine aromatic morello cherry and spice aromas, a dark fruit core with layered earthy spice, and balanced tannins.

BottleName: Devil's Creek 'Gold Reserve' Pinot Noir 2019, Central Otago
Description: Bright and lively Pinot Noir from Central Otago.
Expect fresh-yet-intense notes of raspberry, violet and red cherry. Try it with charcuterie.
A classic Italian red that's loaded with lashings of red and black cherries and dustings of spice.
Expect rich notes of blackberry, hints of wild thyme and soft tannins. Try it with mature cheeses.

BottleName: Bread and Butter Pinot Noir 2019/20, California
Description: A classic Californian Pinot – seriously juicy and seriously fruity. Packed with cranberries, cherries, raspberries and a hint of cedary spice.
Juicy. Fruity. Smooth. Our buyers tasted more than fifty Malbecs to find the very best for you. It’s great quality – and great value.
Yalumba The Cigar Coonawarra Cabernet Australia has a full nose with savoury blackcurrant fruit and on the palate there are layers of plum and cherry fruit and a lengthy savoury textured finish.

BottleName: Three Vintners Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, South Australia
Description: Three Vintners is a celebration of three generations of family winemakers, boasting the best of the secret that's been passed from grandfather to father to son.
Murray Barlow is one of South Africa's most exciting young winemakers and has won Diners Club's Young Winemaker of the Year title an unrivaled twice.
Murray Barlow is one of South Africa's most exciting young winemakers and has won Diners Club's Young Winemaker of the Year title an unrivaled twice.
A bold, hedonistic blend of Grenache, Syrah and Petit Syrah with a whole lot of personality.

BottleName: Managers' Choice: VIK 'A' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/20, Cachapoal Valley
Description: Made just for Majestic customers, it's an elegant medley of ripe, perfumed blackcurrant, cassis, coffee and a divine complexity.

BottleName: Casillero del Diablo Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Chile
Description: Years ago, a winemaker spread a story that the Devil lived in his cellar to scare thieves. But we’re not deterred from this silky, fruity Cabernet.
Pair this Merlot's fruity lashings of red fruit, vanilla and sweet spices with red meats and roasted vegetables.

This second wine is made from the younger vines of Château Ramage la Batisse, a top Cru Bourgeois estate close to Pauillac's Château Mouton Rothschild. Unlike typical clarets which spend time in oak, this is made exclusively in stainless steel and concrete vats. The lack of oak keeps the wine bright and fresh. Expect flavours of briar fruit and plum that pair brilliantly with grilled lamb chops.

BottleName: Vacqueyras 'Grande Garrigues Organic' 2018/19 Alain Jaume, Rhône Valley
Description: Vacqueyras was the second Rhône commune to recognised with 'cru' status. A step up from other Rhône reds it's famed for bold, perfumed reds.

BottleName: Domaine Gayda 'Chemin de Moscou' Organic 2018/19, Pays d'Oc
Description: This blend of low-yield Syrah, Grenache and Cinsault is startlingly good. The 2017 vintage was awarded 93 points by Decanter Magazine.
Expect flavours of black plum, blackberry, liquorice and woody spice. Try it with lamb kebabs.
Complex and fresh, with flavours of raspberry, blackcurrant and cherry. Try it with duck.
Talbott Vineyards put the prestigious Santa Lucia Highlands on the wine world map with its excellent cool-climate wines.
It's deep and concentrated, with hints of ripe red fruits, liquorice and smoke. It has delicate tannins and well-integrated oak influence that are fantastic with a roast dinner.

BottleName: Cornas 'Les Grandes Terrasses' 2014 Paul Jaboulet Aîné, Rhône Valley
Description: Its hints of black fruits, cedar, pepper and smoke will taste even better over the next decade. Wine Advocate's Jeb Dunnuck gave the 2014 vintage 90 Parker Points.

BottleName: Château Tour du Haut-Moulin 2013, Haut Médoc
Description: Now showing a good degree of maturity with its deep garnet colour, mellow bramble fruit and gentle notes of cedar and dark spice. Ripe tannins and soft fruit flavour provide a harmonious mouthfeel.
Amazingly smooth with dense, ripe blackberry and plum fruit, leading to a rounded finish. Extremely versatile, this wine can go with most meat dishes and is eminently drinkable on its own.
Plum. Black cherry. Garrigue herbs. This is seriously plush Châteauneuf from a producer who takes low yields and late harvests to the extreme.
The family makes this Merlot-dominated blend from vines with an average age of 35-years-old. A classical style of claret with notes of briar fruit and cedar.
Barbaresco is the less tannic sibling of Barolo. The wine here is also made from the Nebbiolo grape, but typically aged for a shorter period.
Made primarily from Sangiovese, this is a smooth wine with notes of ripe red fruits and a balancing acidity. Excellent with mushroom pasta.

BottleName: Marcarini Barolo del Comune di La Morra 2016/17, Italy
Description: Barolo is widely considered Italy's king of wines. This is rich, with a fresh bouquet of violets and roses and a long, intense finish.
A fantastic Cabernet-dominated claret from a cru bourgeois exceptional estate.
A deep, silky Côte-Rôtie made by one of the biggest names in the Rhône
Powerful and dazzling. An affordable, powerful red Burgundy from a historic estate.
A deep, powerful red Burgundy from a recently relaunched domain that's already won 39 medals.
Expect ripe notes of cherry, fig, plum and black peppery from this juicy, persistent wine. Excellent with lamb.
Expect aromas of red and black fruits and smoke, flavours of ripe blackberries and cherries, firm tannins and a hint of oak. Try it with roast beef.
A beautifully structured single-vineyard Pinot Noir from one of New Zealand's top winemakers.
Expect rich notes of black plum and blackcurrant, with a hint of cedar. Match the intense aromatics with a smoky truffle risotto.
This blend of local grape varieties is bold and juicy. There’s a delicate note of violet alongside ripe cherry, and soft tannins on the persistent finish. It’s fantastic with roast lamb.
Notes of blackberry, ripe cherries and tobacco, well-integrated tannins and a long finish. Try it with roast beef or pork.
Expect enticing aromas of raspberry, cherry and liquorice, with elegant tannins. The perfect match? Charcuterie and cheese boards.
There’s notes of red and black fruits with a spicy hint of vanilla and elegant tannins on the finish. Enjoy it with beef Wellington.
Expect notes of plum, blackberry, spice and dried herbs and silk-smooth tannins. Drink now with grilled lamb, or cellar it for another 10 years.
Smooth, fine and complex, with notes of cedar, black plum and blackcurrant. Try it with a hearty meat casserole.
It boasts elegant notes of red fruit and black pepper and herbaceous aromas. Try it with roasted portobello mushrooms.
Unashamedly big, bold and juicy with a balancing acidity and a long finish. Try it with herby sausages.

BottleName: Château Branaire Ducru 'Duluc de Branaire Ducru' 2016, Saint-Julien
Description: It's complex and full-bodied, with notes of blackcurrant, cherry, cedar and spice. It has a classic earthiness that's fantastic with lamb.

This is made from 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, a high tannin, high acidity and full-bodied grape variety. Thanks to Languedoc's warm climate, and the resulting ripe grapes, this is a deliciously concentrated Cabernet.
Typically light bodied and floral Beaujolais. Try it with charcuterie or grilled meats.

This is made from Grenache and Carignan. Grenache brings body and red-fruit flavour. Carignan brings tannins and hints of sweet spices. Crucially, this is made from very old vines, which produce intensely concentrated grapes.

BottleName: Abbotts & Delaunay 'Le Métayage' Organic Pinot Noir 2020
Description: To keep the fresh flavours, the grapes behind this are harvested at night. The wine then sees just a touch of oak to dial up the texture but maintain the fruit-forward nature. Try it with roast chicken.
It's smooth and mellow, with hints of red cherry, tobacco and vanilla that are ideal with tapas.
A luscious South African Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre blend with a sophisticated Old World touch. It has aromas of red cherry, plum and black pepper spice.

BottleName: Emiliana ‘Mr Wildman’ Organic Carménère, Colchagua Valley
Description: A silky-smooth Carménère made by a producer named Winery of the Year in 2016 by Wines of Chile. It has flavours of blackberry, red berry, green pepper and spice.

BottleName: Monte da Ravasqueira ‘Mocho Galego Premium Red’, Alentejano
Description: A traditional blend of native Portuguese grapes, Aragonez, Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira. Expect juicy flavours of blueberry, black cherry, vanilla and spice.
This fruit-forward, sophisticated Shiraz is carefully aged in American and French oak. This invites notes of clove and vanilla to the fruit-forward flavours of blackberry and bramble fruit.
This big juicy red is packed with soft plum, bramble and cherry flavours.  It is soft and supple and makes a gloriously approachable wine to enjoy on its own or with grilled meats.

BottleName: Caruso & Minini 'Corte Ferro' Nerello Mascalese-Frappato 2019/20, Sicily
Description: Caruso & Minini are one of the producers defining Sicily's wine revolution.
What do a pharmaceutical chemist and candlelit cellars have in common? La Rioja Alta. A fusion of tradition and science – it’s the definition of Rioja.
A symphony of ripe, dense black fruit flavour, structured by muscular yet velvety tannins.

BottleName: Château Coufran 2007 Haut-Médoc Cru Bourgeois Supérieur
Description: This wine has a soft, fleshy and ample feel, combining soft bramble and ripe plum flavours with smooth tannins. Subtle cedar and leaf aromas complete the picture.
Punching well above its price point, this delicious Saint-Émilion-lookalike is from the same family as First Growth £1,000-a-bottle Château Lafite.

When the neighbours’ wines sell for £50+ a bottle, you know you’re onto a good thing. 500 meters from St Julien – great flavour meets great value. It’s packed with really rich, dark fruit flavours. Plum. Blackberry. Classic Cabernet cassis. Delicious with roast red meat.
This Gamay has a classic Burgundian character with lots of fruit flavours and woody notes.
Fleurie is one of the top appellations in Beaujolais. Floral. Delicate. Red berried. It’s typical of the region, from one of the top producers.
This top class wine has a nose dominated by blackberries and cherries and a silky smooth palate with fine tannins combining. Classic Morgon, showing the fruit of Beaujolais and the charm of Burgundy.
Expect intense notes of ripe cherry with hints of tobacco, vanilla and cinnamon spice. Enjoy it with a cheese and charcuterie platter.
The essence of Chianti from one of the most celebrated producers in the Chianti Classico region. Sour cherries. Plum.

BottleName: Cantina Negrar 'Vigneti di Roccolo' Amarone della Valpolicella 2018
Description: Amarone has only existed since 1938, but it’s one of the kings of Italian wine. Velvety. Full bodied. Made with sun-dried grapes – it’s truly unique.
Sumptuous Amarone from Masi – a byword for quality in Italian wine. Plush with dried fruits and savoury spice, it’s a benchmark for the style.
It's a step up from other Montepulciano, boasting notes of ripe cherries, sweet spices and an alluring hint of smoke. It's comfort food in a bottle.
Rich. Warm. Vanilla-spiced. Aged in oak for fifty percent longer than legally required for more finesse, and soft tannins which make it extra smooth.

BottleName: Olivier Dubois 'Cuvée Prestige' Pinot Noir 2020/21, Loire
Description: The Loire is a real insider secret for Pinot Noir lovers. It’s where to look for juicy, red-fruit-scented Pinot which is great quality – and great value.
It has fresh, fruity notes of cherry and raspberry, with gentle softness. Try it with a roasted or pan-fried duck breast.

BottleName: Domaine de Valmoissine Pinot Noir 2018/19, Louis Latour
Description: Delicious and affordable? It’s rare to find a Pinot which is both. Leave it to Latour, master of top-quality Burgundian reds. Silky and berry-fruity.

BottleName: Domaine de Villemajou 2018/19 Corbières Boutenac, Gérard Bertrand
Description: Rich and complex, with jammy blackcurrant fruit and hints of roasted coffee bean, leather and soft spice notes. Round and soft on the palate, with supple, well-weighted tannins.
It has flavours of red fruits and toasty oak. Try it with red meat and grilled vegetables.

In 1973 a group of foodie friends decided to make a Rioja which was expressly designed to go with food. They succeeded. 50 years later, their wines are still renowned for being food-friendly. This is ripe and full of red-fruit flavour with hints of toasty coconut, vanilla and spice. Perfect for roast lamb and all the trimmings.

BottleName: Rioja Reserva Viña Ardanza 2012 Magnum, La Rioja Alta
Description: Complex and perfumed primary and secondary aromas of earth, spice and red fruits with a long, elegantly structured medium weight body of spicy tannins and layers of flavour.
A robust ruby red wine, with dense aromas of red berries and pudding spice. Flavours on the palate are bright, thick and jammy, with fine-grained, well integrated tannins and good length.

BottleName: Château Montelena Cabernet Sauvignon 2017/18, Napa Valley
Description: A medium-bodied, velvety Cabernet Sauvignon made by one of Napa Valley's oldest estates.

BottleName: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 'Artemis' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, Napa Valley
Description: On the palate it is rich and has lots of depth, huge flavours of cherry, coffee and chocolate are underpinned by ripe tannins and good acidity. This would be ideal with Sirloin steak and chips.
Intense Malbec from the pioneer of high-altitude Malbec. Delicious, chocolatey and black-fruit-scented.
Duckhorn's celebrated Merlot expertise at a lower price.
This pumps with black-fruit flavour. If you like a full-bodied red with gallons of taste, you'll love this.
Ripe red-fruit aromas with bitter black cherry, spice, cigar tobacco, mocha and vanilla. A ripe and textured palate of integrated tannins, red-fruit and spice with a fresh, weighty finish.
Pinotage is South Africa's star grape. So we tasked two award-winning South African winemakers with making it phenomenal at a pocket-friendly price.

BottleName: Jim Barry 'Cover Drive' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, Australia
Description: This Cabernet is bursting with ripe notes of black fruits and cedar. It's an Australian claret double at a snip.
''Very deep garnet-purple colored, notes of warm blackberries and blueberries with nuances of menthol, some spice cake, anise and bacon fat''. 91 points. Lisa Perrotti-Brown, The Wine Advocate.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Gnarly Dudes' Shiraz 2020, Barossa Valley
Description: Expect flavours of fig, blackcurrant, cedar, liquorice and tar. Try it with a rib-eye steak.

A lively and juicy representation of this variety, with a soft and supple texture, bright brambly fruit and subtle notes of spice and tobacco leaf, and a hint of vanilla from six months in French oak.

BottleName: Santa Rita Medalla Real Carménère 2019/20, Colchagua Valley
Description: Plush. Velvety. Smooth. Carménère was one the key components of great claret when First Growths were defined – but it’s now found mainly in Chile.

BottleName: Errazuriz Estate Series Pinot Noir 2019/20, Valle de Aconcagua
Description: The fresh palate displays fruit that is well-balanced by smoky nuances from the oak ageing. an excellent partner to roast pork, fillet of salmon or turkey.

BottleName: Don Maximiano Founder's Reserve 2013 Errazuriz, Aconcagua Valley
Description: A broad and expressive wine, offering concentrated cherry, cassis and raspberry fruit, intertwined with robustly savoury nuances of spice.

BottleName: La Garnatxa Fosca 2018/19 Proyecto Garnachas de España, Priorat
Description: Proyecto Garnachas de España is a project led by Raul Acha to protect Spain's old Garnacha vines.

BottleName: Crozes-Hermitage 'Les Blason' 2018/19 Cave de Tain, Rhône Valley
Description: True to Crozes-Hermitage fashion, this Syrah, made by one of the leading wineries in the northern Rhône, is juicy and vibrant.
We commissioned this cool-climate Merlot from one of the most exciting red-wine regions in New Zealand, Hawke’s Bay. Plummy. Red-fruity. Smooth.
It has ripe notes of black fruits and aromas of cedar and spice. Try it with roast beef.
A benchmark Châteauneuf-du-Pape made by one of the Rhône's star young winemakers.
Surprisingly full-bodied and rich for a Beaujolais Village this possesses intense flavours of blackcurrant and floral notes followed by a silky smooth finish
This has a deliciously intense palate of blackcurrant and wild bramble fruit is lifted with charming hints of thyme and sweet spice. This makes an outstanding partner for rich red meat dishes.
James Martin called Nero Oro ''absolutely fantastic''.
Indulge in Araldica Barbera's cocoa-and-spice-stroked palate of red cherry and dried fruit.
It’s full of ripe and juicy dark raspberry, strawberry and sweet spice. Try this with a hearty beef stew.

BottleName: Bodegas Olarra 'Dehesa de Lantana' Rioja Reserva 2016/17
Description: Reservas are only made in top vintages. Silky, smooth, with sweet fruit and toasty oak, this one’s aged in a cellar nicknamed the ‘cathedral of Rioja wine’.

Wine with intense red colour with violet hints. Intense and mature on the nose with a high presence of fruity hints well blended with the sweet and vanilla oaky notes from the French and American oak.
Uclés DO is an under-the-radar region high in the hills of Castile. This plush, velvety, juicy old-vine red is from its high-altitude vineyards.

BottleName: Behind Closed Doors Reserva Red 2018/19, Lisbon
Description: This powerful blend is a celebration of Portugal’s indigenous grapes – made by the country’s red-blend specialist. Big Bold. Black-fruity.
A restrained and sophisticated Shiraz, with notes of blackberry, black pepper and well-integrated oak. It has ripe tannins that are fantastic with protein-rich meats, like sirloin steak.

BottleName: Te Mata Estate Syrah 2018/19, Hawke's Bay
Description: Strong and powerful wine from the oldest winery in New Zealand. Notes of red fruit, vanilla and allspice.

BottleName: Ernesto Catena Vineyards ‘Ánimal’ Organic Malbec 2020, Mendoza
Description: Expect indulgent notes of plum, blackberry, chocolate and vanilla. It has a snappy acidity that's great for cutting through the fat on T-bone steaks.
Full-bodied and decadent with a lingering finish, Yellow Tail Malbec is bursting with blackberry and cherry notes.

BottleName: The Long Coast Cabernet Sauvignon 2019, Maipo Valley
Description: It's rich and full-bodied, with notes of black fruits, spice and cedar. It has soft tannins which won't overpower the subtle flavours of grilled lamb.

BottleName: Lulu L'Alouette Organic Cabernet Franc 2019, Saumur
Description: A fragrant and light Cabernet Franc from the Loire Valley.
Delve into intense notes of ripe raspberry, cherry, vanilla and pepper.

BottleName: The King's Wrath Pinot Noir 2018/19, Marlborough
Description: Expect blackberry, raspberry, plum and toasted oak. Try it with rich fish, like tuna or trout.

BottleName: Yalumba Y Series Tempranillo 2019, South Australia
Description: Expect flavours of blackberries, cherries, chocolate and sweet spices. Try it with lamb cutlets.
Packed with that enticing red fruit and gamey character that makes red Burgundy so popular. Use it to wash down roasted duck or coq au vin.
Bold Cabernet Sauvignon with notes of blackberry, mocha and vanilla.
A old-vine blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre, it has flavours of raspberry, violet and black pepper.
Made from unoaked, young-vine Grenache and Carignan, with a proportion of oaked Syrah, it's a vibrant and vivid red.

BottleName: Clos de la Grande Grange Organic Côtes du Rhône 2018/19
Description: Clos de la Grande Grange was taken over by Franck Richard in 2013.

BottleName: Beaumes-de-Venise 'La Traissiennes' 2020 Maison Bouachon, Rhône Valley
Description: Beaumes-de-Venise is best known for its sweet wines, but you'll also find fantastic reds here too, like 'La Traissiennes'.

BottleName: Côtes de Beaune Villages 2017/18 Bouchard Aîné et Fils, Burgundy
Description: Bouchard Aîné & Fils has produced Pinot Noir in the heart of Burgundy since 1750.
Delicate Pinot Noir from the Californian coast with notes of cherry and cola.
Expect rich notes of black fruits, fresh acidity and soft tannins. Try it with chorizo.

BottleName: Paul Jaboulet Aîné 'Parallèle 45' Organic Côtes du Rhône 2019/20
Description: This is wonderfully fragrant, with floral, bramble and sweet spice notes. Bold, ripe fruit flavours make it a superb choice to enjoy with a cheese board.
E. Guigal is one of the finest producers in the Rhône Valley. Here, it presses Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre and ages the wine for two years in oak. Jeb Dunnuck gave the 2016 vintage 93-95 points.
Flavours of cherry, berry jam, raspberry and warm spice that are great with roast chicken.

BottleName: Clos de Luz 'Arao' Carménère Red Blend 2018/19, Chile
Description: Plum. Blueberry. Cherry. A Burgundian twist on Chile's star grape, with a dash of Cabernet and Syrah.
A Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon.
This organic expression is intense yet delicate, with aromas of blackberry, cherry and violet and a long, velvety finish.
There's Chianti, and then there's Chianti Rufina. The small region is famed for the finest Chianti and this is your chance to find out why.
Catalanes is nestled between the the Mediterranean sea, the Pyrénées and Corbieres mountains. This region is a melting pot of French and Spanish cultures, and this reflects in this plump, juicy red.
Ernst Loosen's family have made fantastic Riesling on the Mosel slopes for over 200 years. But to get the best from Pinot Noir, he headed to Pfalz.
A rich, powerful and complex claret from a first-class Pomerol estate.
This Austrian wine is a project between the prestigious Bauer family and one of the country's leading wine experts, Ferdinand Mayr.
This is made by one of Portugal's most awarded winemakers. Expect brambly fruit and a kick of spice. Put this magnum centrepiece when serving casserole.

BottleName: Domaine Lucien Lardy Morgon 2019/20, Côte du Py
Description: Côte du Py makes a claim as the finest vineyard area of Morgon.  This brings a delicious wine to your glass. Expect notes of cherry, blackberry and oak. Pair this with roast chicken.
In Rioja, patience is a virtue. This is aged for more than five years before it’s even released. The savoury dried-fruit flavours are worth the wait.
Expect flavours of red berries and spice that are fantastic with French-style steak frites.

BottleName: Marqués de Murrieta Rioja Gran Reserva 2014/15
Description: A hand-made, world-class Gran Reserva by the first of the historic Rioja houses.
The low-alcohol choice for fans of Spanish reds. Fresh and juicy with notes of red cherry and violet.

BottleName: Château de Ferrand 2011 Magnum, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
Description: A dark and intense Bordeaux blend from a chateau favoured by the court of Louis XIV. Expect dark, intense notes of blackberry, cherry and truffle. Match this with a smoky truffle risotto.

BottleName: Domaine des Tourelles 'Grand Cuvée Pierre Brun' 2015, Lebanon
Description: Notes of black cherry, blackcurrant, cedar and chocolate that are great with a lentil stew.
Big, bold and very drinkable flavours of brambly fruit and spice that are great with a casserole.

BottleName: Majestic Fresh and Juicy 2020/21, South Africa
Description: Expect ripe notes of plum with uplifting hints of spice. Serve with stonebaked pizza.
Flavours of redcurrants, dark cherries, vanilla and chocolate that are great with beef shortribs.
A Shiraz blend with full notes of vanilla, chocolate and cedar spice. Great with braised beef.

BottleName: Le Cellier des Papes Châteauneuf-du-Pape 2020, Half Bottle
Description: Expect intense notes of black berries, leather, red fruit, liquorice, chocolate and spices. Try it steak and blue cheese.
It has concentrated notes of blackcurrant, black olive, ripe plums, cardamom and black pepper. Try it with barbecued ribs or juicy beef burgers.

BottleName: Tenuta San Giorgio ‘Ugolforte’ Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2015
Description: Expect aromas of wild strawberry, mint leaf and wood, and a velvety texture with dark-fruit flavours. Try it with grilled meats, truffle-laced pasta or hearty game dishes.

BottleName: Château Trotte Vieille 2011, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
Description: Powerful and dense, with luscious notes of cassis, liquorice, blueberry, toast and cigar box. Try it with venison in a red wine sauce.
It's remarkably fruity, with flavours of blackcurrant, cherry and cedar. Try it with seared duck breast.

BottleName: Château du Tertre 'Les Hauts du Tertre' 2018, Margaux
Description: It's full-bodied and ripe, with flavours of blackcurrant, red cherry, spice and dried herbs. It has a snappy acidity that's great with cheese.

Made purely from grapes grown on the Domaine Saint Rosé estate. Grenache brings body and red-fruit flavours. Syrah (also known as Shiraz) adds tannin and peppery hints. Mourvèdre brings complexity in the form of black-fruit notes. Try it with a tomato-based pasta or red meats.
This is a Merlot-dominated claret, with a small amount of Cabernet Sauvignon. It's remarkably smooth, rounded and supple. Try it with roast beef.

Grenache brings body and red-fruit flavours. Syrah (also known as Shiraz) adds tannin and peppery hints. Mourvèdre brings complexity in the form of black-fruit notes. Try it with a tomato-based pasta or red meats.

BottleName: Andeluna Anduco ‘Limited Edition’ Malbec, Uco Valley
Description: A striking example of high-altitude Malbec from a dynamic, family-owned winery. Expect lush black plum, violet and sweet spice flavours. It’s the perfect red for feasting.

BottleName: Berton Vineyards ‘Foley’s Corner’ Merlot, South Australia
Description: A modern, fresh Merlot made with minimal intervention. It’s wonderfully balanced, with flavours of black plum, violet and earthy herbs.
It's bold and spicy, with flavours of black fruits, liquorice, vanilla and dark chocolate. Try it now with roast beef in a pepper sauce or cellar until 2060.
Mendoza is Argentina’s Malbec hotspot – and Uco Valley is the best of the best. Plush. Silky. Vibrantly fruity. It’s big and bold – an real classic.
A full-bodied, bold Bordeaux with fresh notes of dark fruit, spice and elegant tannins.
This claret is steeped in history. The château was favoured by Henry IV – and uses old Bordeaux variety Carménère in the blend. Ripe, fresh and full of black fruit.
This abundantly fruity expression of Carménère possesses dark fruit flavours heightened by rich notes of chocolate and subtler notes of spice, herbs and olives.
Smooth. Easy-drinking. Fruity. This firm Majestic favourite is as food-friendly as they come – and it’s unoaked for maximum black-cherry and herb flavour.
This Château neighbours wineries that charge £50+ per bottle. And its claret is exceptional. Blackberry. Cherry. Mocha.
A Saint-Émilion dupe – at a fraction of the usual price. Smooth, silky, black-fruity claret from one of Saint-Émilion’s top satellite appellations.
This is a smooth and powerful wine with big flavours of blackcurrant, liquorice and sweet spices

BottleName: Louis Jadot Bourgogne Pinot Noir 'Les Pierres Rouges' 2019/20
Description: Displaying subtle hints of red fruit and violets on the nose, with a well rounded palate of cherry and raspberry fruit with a rounded texture. Gently tannic and with good length.
This wine is stuffed full of bright red fruit flavours, think cherries and redcurrants, with a fine firm tannic structure and balancing acidity that makes it a great foil for all manner of food.
Juicy. Silky. Fruity. It’s textbook Côtes de Rhône. Named after Léon Perdigal, the legendary first cellarmaster at Ogier’s famous Châteauneuf cellar.
This light bodied red has vibrant flavours of strawberry, cherry and redcurrant.  It is soft and rounded with a delicate, fresh finish.
Dried cherry, blackberry, leather and tobacco enhance the wine's medium build and silky texture.
A nose of cherry-like fruit and subtle floral hints and a dry, harmonious palate combining lipsmacking acidity and fine tannins. At its best enjoyed with platter of mixed antipasti or goose.
Full-bodied Tempranillo with rich, complex flavours of ripe black fruit, chocolate and vanilla spice. Enjoy it with juicy lamb shanks.

BottleName: Muga Rioja Prado Enea Gran Reserva 2014
Description: This divine 2011 vintage of Muga's legendary Prado Enea scored 99 points when James Suckling listed it as number #3 of his 'Top Wines in the World'.

Smooth. Supple. Blackberry and vanilla scented Reserva – a real classic from Muga, renowned as the most traditional bodega in Haro, Rioja’s capital. Think blackberry, vanilla, coffee and a hint of spice. It’s smooth. It’s mellow. It’s delicious with rack of lamb.

BottleName: Cillar D Silos 'Torresilo' 2018, Ribera del Duero
Description: An intense, complex Ribera del Duero made partially from 100-year-old vines. Will age excellently.
An elegant Alicante wine with flavours of bramble fruit, dark cherry and flowers. Excellent concentration of flavour.
Chronic Cellars was founded by two brothers born-and-bred in Paso Robles. Plummy. Rich. Ripe. It’s a big and bold red – classic California.
Blackcurrant. Plums. Spice. The number one most awarded Malbec worldwide in 2018 and 2019, grown in the Andean foothills 5000 feet above sea level.
Blackberry. Violet. Black pepper. This Malbec is fermented in traditional concrete vats instead of oak – making it especially juicy and fruity.
The delicious secret behind this Malbec blend is Touriga Nacional. In this, it adds a colossal  burst of red-fruit flavour. It's delicious.

BottleName: Ten Minutes by Tractor Estate Pinot Noir 2018, Mornington Peninsula
Description: A silky, complex red from one of Australia's finest Pinot Noir regions, Mornington Peninsula.

BottleName: Montes Single Vineyard Merlot 2019/20, Colchagua Valley
Description: This will be perfect with nice pink roast lamb.

BottleName: Rioja Gran Reserva 2011 Dehesa de Lantana
Description: Gran Reserva Rioja must spend at least two years in barrel, followed by a further three years in bottle.
The 2010 vintage in the Haut-Medoc region was one of the decade’s finest. So if you’re adding just one bottle of great-value Bordeaux to your wine rack, make it this.

BottleName: Les Frères Lumière Côtes du Rhône
Description: This blockbuster raspberry-and-pepper flavoured red is a homage to this special region that gave us both wine and cinema.
Dry and possessing a velvety softness this is an ideal food wine. Pair the cherry flavours with herb infused pasta and lamb dishes.

BottleName: Jean Bon Merlot IGP Pays D'Oc 2020
Description: Notes of cassis, raspberry and hints of black pepper compliment the palate while being serenaded by the aroma of sweet black berries.
Torbreck is one of the most celebrated producers in Barossa, the New World's full-bodied-Shiraz nirvana.
In quintessential Aussie Shiraz style, Yellow Tail Shiraz is both rich and lively, with a deep red berry, spice and liquorice palate.

BottleName: Cono Sur Bicicleta Pinot Noir 2019, Chile
Description: Cherry. Blackberry. Plum. It’s light, juicy and vibrantly fruity. The UK’s most popular Pinot Noir from two-time IWSC ‘Chilean Winery of the Year’.

BottleName: Touraine Gamay 2020 Domaine Roc de Châteauvieux, Loire
Description: It's not just Beaujolais that can lay claim to terrific Gamay.
An unoaked Grenache blend that's all about fresh and fruity flavour. Expect notes of violet, red fruits, garrigue herbs and a kick of pepper. Try it with roast chicken and lentils.
Plush and fruity Pinot Noir crafted at the foot of Monterey's mountain range. Only 2% of grapes are deemed fit to make it into this wine.
The Perrin family owns one of the best estates in Châteauneuf-du-Pape, but it also makes excellent reds in the many other villages of the Southern Rhône.
Sonoma County native Aaron Piotter harnesses the wild, untamed Zinfandel vines to create this bold, powerful red that's a tribute to the Bear Flag revolt of 1846.
This Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre blend is complex and elegant, with flavours of blackberry, plum and sweet spices.

BottleName: Bodegas Bardos Crianza 2018, Ribera del Duero
Description: Beautifully aromatic with notes of ripe cherry and blackberry, velvety tannins and a complex, spicy finish. The intensity of fruit and fresh acidity makes it an excellent pairing for grilled lamb chops.
This organic Cabernet Sauvignon-Shiraz blend has aromas of white pepper, plum and blackcurrant, juicy, fresh tannins and a hint of oak.
Alberto Zuccardi created Zuccardi wines back in 1963, when he planted his first vines in Mendoza.

BottleName: Indomita 'Gran Reserva' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Casblanca Valley
Description: Luscious and elegant Pinot Noir from Chile's Casablanca Valley.
This wonderfully complex, with flavours of red berries, smoke and sweet spices. It's medium body pairs perfectly with chicken or turkey.

BottleName: Agostina Pieri Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2015/16
Description: Full-bodied and silky. A great-value Brunello di Montalcino.
A dense, powerful blend by one of the pioneering Super Tuscan estates.

BottleName: Vino Nobile Di Montepuliciano 2016/17 Bonacchi, Italy
Description: Made by one of Tuscany’s most exciting up and coming winemakers, this Montepulciano is clean and intense with notes of red fruit, vanilla and sweet spice.
Bardolino is the perfect lunchtime wine. It's light, yet intense and fragrant. Curious? Taste it done by the Allegrinis.
Intense, structured and complex Coonawarra Cabernet with a hint of oak influence.

BottleName: Domaine Marc Delienne 'Avalanche de Printemps' Fleurie 2018
Description: Biodynamic and organic Beaujolais with great ageing potential.
A concentrated, ripe Priorat made from 100 different vineyards by an exceptional winemaker.

BottleName: Alphonse Mellot 'Les Demoiselles' Organic Sancerre Rouge 2018
Description: A red-fruit scented, spicy Pinot Noir from the acclaimed Mellot estate.

A blend of Cabernet, Merlot and the indigenous Feteasca Neagra grape made by one of the country's very best wineries. It's full-bodied and rich with notes of blackcurrant, plum, blueberry and vanilla.
Intriguing and perfumed red Burgundy from the esteemed Morey-Saint-Denis appellation.

BottleName: Errazuriz Max Reserva Cabernet 2018/19, Aconcagua Valley
Description: Named after the founder of Errazuriz, this Cabernet blend is intense and ripe, with aromas of cassis and spice.
Intense notes of red fruits, liquorice, pepper and thyme that are a treat with mature cheeses.
A rich and indulgent Rioja, with notes of red and black fruit, vanilla and liquorice. Try it with Manchego.
It boasts the deliciously aromatic flavours of Grenache, the spicy elements of Syrah and they heady black-fruit hints of Mourvèdre. Try it with lamb shoulder.
Sophisticated Barossa Cabernet Sauvignon – smooth and velvety, with notes of blackcurrant, cedar and cocoa. Fantastic with braised lamb shanks.

BottleName: Rupert and Rothschild Baron Edmond 2017, Western Cape
Description: Flavours of blackberries, dark plum. tobacco, vanilla and toast that are great with a sirloin steak.

BottleName: Château La Fleur Pourret 2015, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
Description: Deep and concentrated, with notes of plum, blackcurrant, spice, cedar and tobacco. Try it with roast beef.
Full-bodied and slightly savoury, with notes of blackcurrant, plum, cedar and leather. Try it with roast leg of lamb and gratin dauphinoise.
It's classically rich and full-bodied with flavours of blackcurrant, black cherry and spice. Perfect with a wild mushroom and truffle risotto.

BottleName: Château de la Cour d’Argent 2014, Bordeaux Supérieur
Description: Expect spicy, fruity aromas with hints of black pepper, blackberries and cinnamon. Try it now with grilled beef or cellar for another decade.

BottleName: Armentia y Madrazo Rioja Gran Reserva 2012
Description: Enjoy its aromas of dark fruit, clove and vanilla spice with roast chicken.
A full-bodied and velvety wine with flavours of black fruit, eucalyptus and spice. Pair it with roasted meats.

BottleName: Jim Barry 'McRae Wood' Shiraz 2014, Clare Valley
Description: A rich, perfumed and spicy style of Shiraz with aromas of black cherry, ripe plum, cardamom and rose.

BottleName: Michele Satta Bolgheri Organic Rosso DOC 2019
Description: A blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet, Merlot, Syrah, and Teroldego grapes that's soft, plummy and gently spicy. Try it with a Tuscan-style steak.

This is made from very old Grenache vines, which produce deeply concentrated grapes. With all efforts on preserving fruit quality, every bunch is hand-picked, and rigorous grape selection is carried out to ensure you taste a beautifully silky red.

BottleName: Paul Jaboulet Aîné ‘La Maison Bleue’ Hermitage Organic 2016
Description: It has complex smoke, spice and dark fruit aromas, plus hints of liquorice and olive, and a very long finish. Try with braised beef stew or juicy grilled steak.
Expect a fine and elegant Beaujolais, with bright flavours of red cherry, strawberry and kirsch. It has light tannins which will pair well with salmon.

BottleName: Lapostolle Cuvée Alexandre Merlot, Apalta DO
Description: Expressive, elegant Merlot from some of the steepest slopes in Chile. The altitude the grapes are grown at has given the wine a freshness that perfectly balances the rich flavours of black cherry, chocolate and vanilla.

BottleName: Quinta da Pedra Alta ‘Forcadas’, Douro Valley
Description: A fantastic blend of handpicked indigenous Portuguese grapes. It’s bold, ripe and full of cherry, plum and sweet spice notes. Fantastic with tapas.
Unmissable Bordeaux crafted by an Australian winemaking legend. A superb meeting of the Old and New World with complex notes of blackberry, raspberry and cedar.

BottleName: Domaine du Tix 'Cuvée de Bramefan' 2016, Ventoux
Description: A Expect notes of cherry, black fruit and dried herbs. Try it with rack of lamb.
It's light and elegant, with flavours of raspberry, strawberry and prune. It's an easy-drinking wine that won't overpower the subtleties of pork.
Deeply concentrated with rich flavours of blackcurrant, ripe plum and pepper spice. Partner with a hearty steak, drizzled in black pepper sauce.
An approachable, medium-bodied wine full of sunny red berry flavour and subtle hints of prune and violet on the nose. Smooth, drying tannins mingle with the  rounded, juicy fruit.
Smooth. Ripe. Juicy. A really fruity Mendoza Malbec – a must-try Majestic exclusive from an area renowned for its high-quality wines.

BottleName: Silver Ghost Cabernet Sauvignon 2020/21, Central Valley
Description: Fruity, juicy, silky Cabernet Sauvignon from one of the most prestigious winemaking families in Chile. Great taste – incredible value.
Lush. Juicy. Ripe. Created to celebrate centuries-old dining clubs where steak was a symbol of wealth – and the ideal partner to Malbec.

BottleName: Château Grand Faurie La Rose St-Emilion Grand Cru 2016/18
Description: This smooth, supremely structured claret is fantastic value – a classic Saint-Émilion, for an absolute steal.
Bright. Fresh. Savoury. Textbook Pinot from one of Burgundy's top producers, Louis Latour. A complete steal for the quality.
Well-balanced and classic Syrah from a range of terroirs in the Rhône and Languedoc.
Intense ruby-purple colour. Ripe blackberry aromas dominate the nose, and are supported by subtle sage-like hints. Supple tannins give a round shape to the medium-weight, smooth-textured palate.
The Guigals are so sure of their wines, they pay growers three times the market rate for their grapes. Lively, spicy with plenty of red fruits. They’ve got it right.
A rich, complex Châteauneuf-Du-Pape made from 45-year-old vines by a star winery.
Expect concentrated aromas of red berries and sweet spices, flavours of ripe raspberry, blackberry and vanilla and soft tannins which are ideal with cheese.

BottleName: Domaine Pardon et Fils ‘Les Mouilles’ Juliénas 2019/20
Description: Expect a deeply coloured wine with fresh, powerful red fruit flavours and a rich character. Allow it to age for up to three years or serve now with coq au vin.
This is a bright, vibrant Gamay with moderate acidity and soft tannins, cherry and raspberry flavours and a pleasant finish.
Dark cherries and leather with earthy hints, and a rose perfume, a charming, well integrated wine with a long finish. Muscular tannins give the wine a solid backbone.

BottleName: Guidalberto 2018/19 Tenuta San Guido, IGT Toscana
Description: The varieties are vinified separately before blending and maturation in French and American oak. The wine has an intense violet colour and a soft and rounded fruit profile.
This lovely ruby coloured wine exhibits aromas of plums, leather and violets.  The palate is rich with red fruits, spice and a hint of smoke.  The finish is long and complex.
This complexity is carried onto the palate with racy acidity and oak bringing freshness and structure whilst the soft tannins makes this wine a viable option to open now.
Expect aromas of vanilla, mulberry and spice, flavours of stewed blackcurrants and a long finish. Decant it for at least an hour before enjoying its fine tannins with lamb.
A polished and complex wine with layers of black fruit, graphite and dried flowers. With an unctuous texture akin to great Pomerol it has fantastic balance and real ageing potential.

BottleName: La Baume Grande Olivette Malbec 2019/20 VdF
Description: This Malbec is all about fresh red cherries, refreshing acidity and floral notes.
Deep purple hue, a beautifully scented nose with herby aromas, lashings of juicy forest fruits and spicy, rich berry flavours on the palate and a good, smooth finish. Perfect with beef shepherds pie.
Expect flavours of blackcurrant, raspberry and baking spices. It has firm tannins that are great with a casserole.
Supple and inviting, this wine blends the soft and jammy raspberry fruit of ripe Grenache with the firming influences of Carignan's blackberry flavours and robust tannin.
Celebrity chef James Martin said a previous vintage was one of the nicest reds he’d tasted in ten years of Saturday Kitchen. Bold. Juicy. Jammy.
Love Pinot Noir but don’t love the price tag? Insiders look to Romania for fresh, juicy, approachable Pinot. It can’t be beaten on price or flavour.

BottleName: Edna Valley Pinot Noir 2018/19, Central Coast
Description: A light and silky Californian Pinot Noir with flavours of blackberry compote, black cherry and cranberry. Try it with roast lamb.

BottleName: Villa Maria Cellar Selection Pinot Noir 2019/20, Marlborough
Description: Medium bodied with beautifully poised red fruit and very well integrated oak flavours. The crisp acidity and fine grained tannins provide a delightfully clean long finish of considerable finesse.

BottleName: Mud House Pinot Noir 2019/20, Central Otago
Description: An intense and powerful Pinot, full of bright red cherry and darker bramble fruit, layered with gentle notes of mocha and spice. Finely balanced tannin and acidity provide greap grip and length.

BottleName: Mud House 'Claim 431' Pinot Noir 2017/20, Central Otago
Description: Vibrant. Fresh. Supple. Discover dark plum and ripe cherry flavours, with subtle hints of earthiness and woodspice. The lively aromas and acidity makes it a great match for a big bowl of fresh pesto pasta.

BottleName: The Ned 'Southern Valleys' Pinot Noir 2019, Marlborough
Description: Ripe. Juicy. Fruity. Really silky, berry-fruit Pinot Noir from Marlborough’s Southern Valleys, made by the region’s star – Brent Marris.
Full bodied, with rich, dark, supremely concentrated cassis-scented black fruit and a warm, spicy finish. Excellent with steaks, roast beef or, if you are feeling adventurous, haggis.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Sexy Beast' Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, McLaren Vale
Description: A deep and lush ruby colour, with an alluring nose of rich fruit, and subtle touches of violet, smoke, and leafy herbs. Fulsome yet elegant, the tannins are smooth and the palate tightly structured.

BottleName: Château Grimont 'Cuvée Prestige' 2017/18, Cadillac Côtes de Bordeaux
Description: Made from selected parcels of grapes grown on clay/gravel soils this is a classic claret with flavours of blackcurrant, plum and cedar. Aged to perfection, this is a treat you will not want to miss.
It's well-balanced and rich, with flavours of black fruits and cedar. Try it with roast beef.
Ripe, intense and packed full of character. This St Julien is the fruit of an ideal Bordeaux vintage.
'Cru Bourgeois' estates are increasingly contesting the finest Châteaux for quality in Médoc. They have to reapply for the status every five years, so they can't rest of their laurels.

BottleName: Château Cap de Faugères 2011, Castillon Côte de Bordeaux
Description: Taste the brilliance in notes of black fruit, cherry, plum, sweet spices and espresso.

BottleName: Châteauneuf du Pape 'Les Sinards' 2018/19 Famille Perrin
Description: With the 2017 vintage alone scoring five 90+ point scores from some of the most respected wine critics.
Expect concentrated red-fruit flavours and elegant tannins that are great with red meat and cheese.
Deep red in color with a nose of black cherries, blackberries and currant kissed with a touch of praline.. The palate is sweet and slightly spicy with fine tannins and a silky finish.

BottleName: Georges Vigouroux 'Le Grand Retour' Malbec 2018/20, Cahors
Description: Malbec began in France. And this is a celebration of everything great about the grape in its birthplace.

BottleName: Lopez de Heredia 'Viña Tondonia' Rioja Reserva 2008/09
Description: A fantastic Rioja Reserva aged for six years by the bodega. Fresh cherry. Sweet spices.
Just a short period in oak means this Crianza's all about the fruit.
A gloriously long Reserva from an excellent modern-day bodega.

BottleName: Chronic Cellars 'Sir Real' Cabernet Sauvignon 2019/20, Paso Robles
Description: A lavish, smooth Cabernet made by Paso Robles locals with links to the finest grapes.
Silky, red-fruity, high-altitude Malbec. Made mainly with fruit from the expensive Uco Valley, a labelling law quirk means you get it for a song.
This juicy Cabernet-Merlot blend has opulent strawberry and raspberry flavours and soft tannins. Pair with a steak sandwich or rich pork stew.
Rich. Heady. The renowned Peter Lehmann wines have captured everything great about Barossa wine in a bottle.
Plush and rich with flavours of blackberry, black plum and liquorice. Try it with your meatiest beef burger.
Unashamedly powerful and fruity this is resplendent with cherry and raspberry flavours followed buy notes of sweet spice and star anise.

BottleName: Lulu L'alouette Organic Cabernet Franc 2019/20, Chinon
Description: Cabernet Franc rules the roost in Chenon, one of the Loire's very few red-dominated regions.

It’s beautifully aromatic, with notes of ripe cherry, blackberry and savoury dried herbs. 14 months of oak ageing shows itself in notes of pepper and spice, which adds to the luxuriously long finish. Enjoy this with roast pigeon.
Ripe and generous, Lirac offer a superb alternative to Châteauneuf-du-Pape, and 2016 was a sublime vintage for this spot of the southern Rhône.
A blend of Grenache, Syrah, Cinsault and Mourvèdre, it has hints of strawberry jam and black fruits, ripe tannins and a long finish.

BottleName: Figure Libre Freestyle Organic Rouge 2020 Domaine Gayda, Pays d'Oc
Description: The Freestyle Rouge is an organic rule-breaking blend from acclaimed Domaine Gayda.
Expect complex aromas of red berries, sage, rose petals and tobacco. Elegant fruity flavours and smooth tannins will pair brilliantly with baked mushrooms.
A heady, limitless red pumping with blackcurrant, plum and vanilla flavours
Unoaked and fresh, it has notes of ripe red fruits, liquorice and spice and smooth tannins.

BottleName: Cave de Hunawihr Kuhlmann-Platz 'Cuvée Prestige' Pinot Noir 2019/20, Alsace
Description: This is a light and fresh Pinot Noir, with flavours of cherry, strawberry, sweet spices and cedar. Try it with turkey or chicken.
Aged for a generous fourteen months in oak to deepen its complexity. Expect a rich dark fruit palate with notes of mocha and earthy spice.

BottleName: Agricola Fuster 'Dardell' Organic Red 2020, Terra Alta
Description: Terra Alta means 'high land' in Catalan, so it's no surprise that the mountainous region is famed for its elegant high-altitude wines.
Lush. Rounded. The family behind Framingham make some of the best value Pinot Noir from New Zealand.

BottleName: Emiliana 'Elemental' Organic Gran Reserva Cabernet 2018/19, Maipo Valley
Description: Emiliana were voted Winery of the Year 2016 by Wines of Chile. They're leading the way with delicious organic wines at great value.
The Definition of Pauillac claret from one of the most prestigious Châteaux in the appellation.
A fruity, full-bodied red made from indigenous Italian grape varities. Excellent with cold-cut meats and cheese.
One of the king's of Italian wine. It's intense and wonderfully aromatic, with notes of red fruits and creamy oak and silk-smooth tannins. Try it with game birds or a roast dinner.
Port claims the headlines. But the Douro Valley is also the source of some of Portugal's most celebrated table wines.

BottleName: Domaine Robert Sirugue 'Les Trois Terroirs' 2018/19, Vosne-Romanée
Description: Three ideal Burgundy terroirs are behind this fruit-forward and complex wine. Excellent ageing potential.
Silky, full-bodied and ideal for ageing. This is Barbaresco at its most classic.
Intense and perfumed. This single-vineyard Amarone has a wonderful complexity and velvety finish.

BottleName: Domaine Georges Lignier et Fils Volnay Premier Cru 2017/18
Description: Perfumed and smokey. A wonderful Pinot Noir from four Premier Cru sites.

BottleName: Castello Banfi ‘Poggio alle Mura’ Brunello di Montalcino 2015/16
Description: Complex and elegant Brunello from one of Montalcino's most beautiful estates.
Refined and incredibly complex. This classic Barolo is a must-have for budding collectors.

BottleName: Cape Mentelle Cabernet Sauvignon 2016, Margaret River
Description: Cape Mentelle are famous for pioneering Cabernet Sauvignon in the Margaret River region. Expect notes of bramble fruit, vanilla and orange peel. Pair with steak and peppercorn sauce.
Discover complex notes of dark forest fruit, mocha and molasses. This will pair well with anything seasoned with Provençal herbs, so try roast lamb.
Notes of cherry, redcurrant, liquorice and vanilla that are great with duck confit.

BottleName: Château du Domaine de l'Eglise 2011, Bordeaux
Description: Elegant notes of plums and crème de cassis with a refined minerality. It'll pair well with lamb and a red wine sauce.

BottleName: Gérard Bertrand Clos d'Ora Organic 2017, Minervois La Livinière
Description: It's robust and powerful yet remarkably elegant, with flavours of red cherries, dark chocolate and tobacco. Decant for an hour before serving now or age for up to 20 years.
An elegant, opulent Barossa Shiraz with aromas of dark plum, cocoa and subtle spice. Partner with braised beef.

BottleName: Bodegas Riojanas 'Viña Albina' Rioja Gran Reserva 2004
Description: Expect flavours of red cherry, coffee, vanilla and chocolate. Try it with Riojan cod and red peppers.

BottleName: Vigneti del Salento ‘Zolla’ Primitivo di Manduria DOC Riserva 2017
Description: Expect notes of violets, blackberries and cherry. Drink with hard cheeses.
Expect flavours of ripe plum, damson, red cherry and smoky vanilla, and elegant tannins. Partner with pan-seared tuna steak.

BottleName: Peter Lehmann 'The Barossan' Shiraz 2019 Magnum, Barossa
Description: A celebration-perfect magnum of Barossa Shiraz with flavours of dark plum, strawberry, mocha and spice. Superb with steak.
Full and intense, with notes of red fruits and sweet spices. Try it with braised meats.

BottleName: P.S Garcia Pinot Noir 2018, Casablanca Valley
Description: Expect bright notes of strawberry, complex earthy aromas and a refreshing acidity. Try pairing this with roast chicken, stuffed with herbs.

The Merlot brings the body, while the Cabernet Sauvignon adds tannins and acidity - which make claret famously suitable for ageing. Oak maturation increases the tannins and imparts hints of vanilla and earth. Great with roast beef.

Gamay is the dominant grape variety in Beaujolais. It has thin skins and this means that there are low levels of tannin extracted in the winemaking process. As a result, the wine is typically light bodied and floral. Try it with charcuterie or grilled meats.
70% of this blend is Syrah, so you can expect high tannins and a full body. Grenache and Mourvèdre bring alcohol and black-fruit flavours respectively.

BottleName: Domaine La Pousse d’Or ‘Les Caillerets’ Volnay Premier Cru 2011
Description: It's complex and intense, with flavours of red fruits, sweet spices, earth and mushroom. Try it with game or roast pork.
Expect flavours of strawberry and redcurrant and a long, pleasant finish. Ideal with grilled meats and cheese.
A classic Merlot-dominated blend from Haut-Médoc – Old World winemaking royalty – home to some of the world’s most sought-after wines. Expect typical aromas of blackcurrant, red cherries and coffee.

First-class Ribera del Duero made from grapes that are picked from were once used by Bodegas Vega Sicilia – once hailed as Spain’s “First Growth” winery. It has aromas of black fruit, cedar and sweet spice.
A deliciously juicy red wine. It’s rounded texture makes it fantastic for pairing with food. Expect notes of red cherry, plum, dried herbs and spice.

BottleName: Santa Isle ‘Grand Reserve Red Blend’ 2018, Maule Valley
Description: It has aromas of blackcurrant, black pepper and ripe red fruits – as well as an enticing note of chocolate. Soft and juicy tannins mean it’ll really shine when paired with grilled red meats or mature cheeses.
This is savoury and full-bodied, with notes of cedar and tobacco joining flavours of blackcurrant and plum. It has a subtle earthiness that's great with mushroom-based vegetarian dishes or game.

BottleName: Villa Maria Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot 2019, Hawke’s Bay
Description: It's richly concentrated, with aromas of plum, cassis, coffee and thyme. Serve with roast pork, hearty casseroles or spiced lamb.

BottleName: Pasqua 'Desire, Lush and Zin' Primitivo 2020, Puglia
Description: Bold and velvety. Blending two styles of the same grape: the fruitiness of Californian Zinfandel with the spice and richness of Italian Primitivo.
It's a smooth, ripe blend of Corvina, Corvinone and Rondinella grapes, with flavours of red cherries and sweet spices. Try it with antipasti.
It's smooth and silky, with flavours of strawberry, cherry, plum jam and vanilla. It has a balanced acidity that works excellently with cheese.
A rich, ripe Appassimento with notes of red cherry and violet. Excellent with beef stew.

BottleName: Alain Grignon Carignan 'Vieilles Vignes' 2020, Pays de l'Hérault
Description: Juicy. Brambly. Deliciously easy-drinking. This Carignan is all about quality – made from vines which are up to 100 years old.
It's juicy and ripe, with flavours of cherry, black plum, blueberry compote, nutmeg and cloves. Try it with lamb or duck.
This beautiful Gigondas wine with great concentration and balance.

BottleName: Côtes du Rhône Réserve Rouge 2017 Perrin et Fils
Description: Intense aromas of red fruits, black cherry, peppermint and vanilla. Full bodied with warm fruits and spice, firm tannin and fresh acidity. Well structured with layers of flavour and rich, long finish.
This traditional Italian red has a bold ruby red colour, pleasant brambly fruits on the nose and a long, balanced palate with sweet, ripe tannins.
