This great Montepulciano is full of juicy red fruit and relaxed tannins, perfect with pizza.
Ripe cherry and strawberry fruit forms the backbone of this wine, which is medium-bodied and approachable, and fresh in feel. A subtly rustic streak gives a touch of complexity and food friendliness.
It has notes of jammy black fruits, smoky, toasty spice and an elegant structure. Perfect for herb-crusted filet mignon.

BottleName: La Rioja Alta 'Viña Ardanza' Rioja Reserva 2012
Description: A return to the classic Garnacha/Tempranillo Reserva by the highly acclaimed La Rioja Alta.

BottleName: Tinto Pesquera Reserva 2016/17, Ribera del Duero
Description: Ripe, balanced and complex Tempranillo by a driving force behind Ribera del Duero wine.
This super concentrated blend of Carignan, Syrah and Grenache oozes the sun dappled charm of the Languedoc

BottleName: Domaine de la Métairie dAlon Pinot Noir 2017, Languedoc
Description: Barrel-aged, seriously pampered and indistinguishable from Burgundian brilliance, this is top-shelf Pinot Noir from Abbotts & Delaunay, a Majestic favourite.

BottleName: Domaine de la Métairie d’Alon Organic Pinot Noir 2019, Languedoc
Description: It has delicate floral notes and delicious red-berry flavours. Its freshness is highlighted by aromas of ginger, liquorice and white pepper. Enjoy this with roast lamb.

BottleName: Five Foot Track Shiraz 2019, South Eastern Australia
Description: A medium weight red, with a pleasing balance between ripe fruit and savoury, earthy notes on the nose. The palate is succulent and mouth-filling, with lashings of red berry and brambles.
Plum and cherry characters predominate on both nose and palate. Medium-bodied, with supple tannins and a pleasantly soft finish. Perfect with beef.
It's light yet complex with flavours of raspberry, cherry and pomegranate. Try it with a pork and mushroom dish.
As seen on TV. A fresh, fruit driven Pinot Noir choc-full of red fruits with hints of clove, chocolate and coffee.
Buckets of plummy flavour are backed by an alluring vanilla stroke, thanks to a touch of oak influences.

BottleName: Birichino 'Besson Vineyard' Old Vine Grenache 2018, California
Description: The vines on the Besson vineyard are over 100-years-old. It has notes of wild strawberry, pomegranate and anise.
Les Mitans', from winemaking royalty Louis Latour, is sublimely elegant and emits roasted aromas of cherry, coconut and mocha.

BottleName: Monte del Frà 'Scarnocchio' Amarone Della Valpolicella Classico Riserva DOCG 2013
Description: A cream-of-the-crop Amarone made on a single vineyard by the celebrated Monte del Frà winery.

BottleName: Dominio De La Fuente Organic Tempranillo

Description: Made exclusively for Majestic  from 100% Tempranillo this is a medium bodied and soft wine that is packed with juicy red fruit flavours
Easy-drinking, fruit-driven and silky smooth, this is modern Portuguese dining wine at its very best.
This Cabernet from Washington's oldest winery is packed with ripe blackcurrant and blackberry flavours.  Notes of cedar and vanilla follow on to a silky smooth finish that lingers on the palate.
A delicious blend of Tempranillo, Malbec, Merlot, Syrah and even more.
The winemaker behind this powerful Malbec is Daniel Pi, who has been included in leading wine writer Tim Atkin's 2017 Argentina report.
Squeezed from grapes grown at dizzying altitudes in Mendoza, the Composition II is a deep, heady palate of rip black cherry, blackberry and plum.
Grant Burge are one of the Barossa Valley's finest producers. The older the vine, the tastier the grape. And they make this from the grapes on a 100-year-old vineyard.

BottleName: Mount Langi Ghiran Cliff Edge Shiraz 2017
Description: Intense black and blue fruits developed into a slightly savoury almost meaty character. Sophisticated white pepper, sweet spices and a clean, pure acidity mark it out as Shiraz of the highest quality.

It is a dark, concentrated and structured beast that needs more than one look to understand its true value. Enticing perfume of cedar, smoke, game, bacon, and blueberry. Firm and flavourful on the palate.
Yalumba makes its Y Series Merlot with only wild yeast found in the winery.
Expect flavours of liquorice, stewed plum, blackcurrant, dark chocolate and coffee. Drink now with slow-cooked lamb or age until 2040.
This claret, from the sublime 2010 vintage, is made less than ten minutes' drive from 'First Growth' Châteaux Lafite and Mouton Rothschild, which both demand £400+ a bottle.
This shows the elegance, complexity and long-lived character that Cabernet Sauvignon can achieve in Napa. Pour yourself a glass with steak, beef short ribs or roasted portobello mushrooms.
Château Tour de Bigorre has made claret for 80 years.
Torbreck is one of Australia's leading wineries, crafting deluxe reds that stand toe-to-toe with the most expensive in the Rhône Valley.

BottleName: Mt. Brave 'Mt. Veeder' Merlot 2013, Napa Valley
Description: A rich, silky Merlot made by a legendary Napa Valley winemaker.

BottleName: Casella Family 'Limited Release' Cabernet Sauvignon 2013, Wrattonbully
Description: A deep, rich Cabernet Sauvignon made from the finest grapes of Wrattonbully, Australia's next great region.
Under the guidance of Jean-Baptiste Bourrotte, Clos du Clocher's Pomerol vineyards have soared in quality.
Vega Sicilia, Spain's 'First Growth', formed Bodegas Alión next door in an effort to create the new-age face of Ribera del Duero winemaking.
The Côte Chalonnaise was once referred to as the 'Région de Mercurey', which shows how important this famous village is. Aged for 8 months in oak barrels, this is a classical expression of Mercurey.

BottleName: Vacqueyras 2018 Bastide Saint Vincent, Rhône Valley
Description: Vacqueyras was the second Côtes du Rhônes Villages to be upgraded to a full appellation in its own right.
Framingham has made this style its own by using a portion of whole grape bunches. After 10 months in oak, this Pinot has notes of cranberry, cherry, plum and oak spice and silky tannins.
True to its name, Carnivor Zinfandel is a luscious, intense red with bold blackberry and dark cherry fruit.

In the present day, the winery sources the ripest grapes from the Central Coast of California to make this Cabernet Sauvignon, which spends six months in oak. It's full-bodied with notes of blackberry, caramel and mocha.
Vega Sicilia is the most prestigious winery in Ribera del Duero. This is a full-bodied and intense wine, with hints of black fruit, spice and cedar.
Tasmania produces less than 1% of Australian wine. And when you discover a Pinot like this, you win big.
This is the second wine of Château Branaire-Ducru. But it's no second best.
A heavenly nose of cassis, plum and graphite mark this out as a classic Barossa Cabernet. Structured and complex, deep and intense.

BottleName: Bouchard Père & Fils Volnay Premier Cru 2017, Les Caillerets
Description: Fruity, spicy and exceptionally well balanced Volnay Premier Cru from one of Burgundy's oldest estates.
Rich and powerful. This wine is the brilliant sum of 24 generations of winemaking.

BottleName: Kangarilla Road 'Devil's Whiskers' Single Vineyard Shiraz, McLaren Vale
Description: Dark, perfumed and powerful McLaren Vale Shiraz. The very best work of the award-winning winemaker at Kangarilla Road, Kevin O'Brien.
A complex and harmonious premier cru Gevrey-Chambertin. First-class red Burgundy.
A wine that truly represents the vineyard's character.
Brimming with the classic Cabernet bouquet, developing soft supple fruits as the wine ages with a firm structure and acidity. Decant before serving.
A fruity, textured and long South African Pinot Noir that's a big hit with the critics.

BottleName: Bouchard Père & Fils 'Les Lavières' Savigny-lès-Beaune Premier Cru 2014
Description: A fruit-forward and sophisticated red from one of Burgundy's oldest estates.
It's rich and full, with flavours of dark cherries, violets and plum, and a hint of spice. Decant for at least an hour before serving with a ribeye steak now or cellar for up to 30 years.
A fantastic Ribera del Duero red from Spain's leading winery.
A velvety and opulent blend of Tempranillo and Merlot from Spain's leading winery.

BottleName: David Finlayson 'The Pepper Pot' 2018, South Africa
Description: A fresh, fruity and spicy red blend with notes of black fruits and pepper. Try it with pizza and a rocket salad.

BottleName: Louis Martini Cabernet Sauvignon 2017, Napa Valley
Description: This is a savoury and full-bodied wine, with flavours of black plum, blackcurrant and vanilla that are great with red meat and rosemary potatoes.

BottleName: La Rioja Alta 'Finca Martelo' Rioja Reserva 2014
Description: A Reserva only produced in perfect vintages by one of Rioja's star names.
There's a real depth to these savoury notes of black plum, blackcurrant and spice. Serve with sirloin and porcini mushrooms.
Discover rich and juicy notes of blackberry, fig, vanilla and spice. Try pairing it with grilled blue-cheese burgers.

BottleName: Sons of Eden 'Marschall' Shiraz 2017, Barossa Valley
Description: A fresh, vibrant Shiraz with notes of blackberry, red liquorice, plum and spice. Great with lamb.
Discover complex notes of chocolate, coffee and caramel, with a hint of vanilla from classic oak ageing. There's nothing better to go with tapas.
Concentrated and rich, with flavours of black cherry, blackberry, damson, chocolate, coffee, pepper and vanilla. Drink now with lamb or cellar until 2055.

BottleName: Château Lagrave-Aubert 2012, Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
Description: Expect flavours of blackberry, red plum, cedar and earth. Its maturity makes for melted tannins which are a treat with a roast dinner.
It's rich, ripe and full of black fruits. Think blackberry, cocoa, cinnamon, clove and tobacco. Try it with a beef burger or cellar for 10 years.

BottleName: Louis M. Martini 'Monte Rosso Vineyard Gnarly Vine' Zinfandel 2016, Sonoma
Description: It has intense flavours of blackberry, blackcurrant, molasses and vanilla. Try it with grilled red meats.

BottleName: Red Burgundy Reserve Côte d'Or 2016 Labouré-Roi
Description: Light in weight, with a juicy summer-fruit character, where bright flavours of raspberry and strawberry abound. Try with ham.
This declassified Côtes du Rhône blend is everything you'd want at a snip. Packed with red fruits, spice and that all-important dusting of pepper, it's a delicious rule-breaker.
Aromatic and complex with an excellent depth of flavour. A true Super Tuscan from one of Italy's most in-demand wineries, Ornellaia.
Plush and soft Merlot with an excellent texture and hints of vanilla.
Eighty percent of Fitou wine is made by giant wineries. They'd shun Katie Jones' small vineyard, but for her boutique range of wines, these tiny patches of vines are ideal.
This fabulous wine provides wines of similar quality to its more famous neighbour at a fraction of the price

BottleName: Pleiades XXIII Old Vines Sean Thackrey, Bolinas
Description: Dark brick red in colour revealing perfumed aromas of blackberry and strawberry fruits combined with ripe black cherry fruits on the palate. Smooth and enticing with a sheer elegance throughout!
This wine displays classic notes of Blackcurrant, Bramble and white pepper

BottleName: Wolf Blass Yellow Label Cabernet Sauvignon 2019, South Australia
Description: An excellent concentration of blackcurrant fruit flavours, smooth, yet solid tannins and a hint of peppermint on the lingering finish. Partner this with roast lamb or a rich lasagne.

BottleName: Viñalba Fifty 50 Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon 2017, Uco Valley
Description: Typically intense and vibrant, full of inky violet colour, with a juicy damson and blackcurrant backbone characterising both nose and palate.
Luscious dark cherry, blossom fruits, silky soft tannins, and a generous mouthfeel. Partner to red meat and game dishes or mushroom flavoured sauces.
This merlot is soft and smooth and packed with plum flavours.

BottleName: Errazuriz Estate Series Carménère 2018, Aconcagua Valley
Description: On the palate, this medium-bodied wine is structured by big, mouth-filling tannins. Spicy notes linger on the palate, with hints of dark chocolate and coffee, through the long, pleasant finish.

BottleName: Châteauneuf-du-Pape Domaine du Père Caboche 2019, Southern Rhône
Alheit 'Limited Release' Red Blend 2018, Western Cape
Description: Fiona Beckett called Alheit's 'Limited Release' red blend "a joyous, vividly fruity cinsault-based blend that you'll love if you're a Beaujolais fan". A light red from South Africa?
Fed up of astronomical Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon prices? Head to Alexander Valley.
Black current and a touch of pepper.
Plummy and soft this shows just what Chile has to offer - great plum and dark cherry flavours and great value.
Stonier's is one of the best-value Australian Pinot Noir's going.

BottleName: Te Mata Estate 'Awatea' Cabernets/Merlot 2017, Hawke's Bay
Description: First made in 1982, the Awatea is still the benchmark for great-value Hawke's Bay Cabernet/Merlot blends.

BottleName: Jackson Estate Outland Ridge Pinot Noir 2014
Description: You might think California is too hot for the demanding Pinot Noir grape. But in the cooler spots of Anderson Valley, it's in heaven.

BottleName: Mt. Brave 'Mt. Veeder' Malbec 2013, Napa Valley
Description: Mt. Brave is one of the lowest-yielding wineries in one of the rarest spots in Napa Valley.

BottleName: Parcel Series Hawkes Bay Cabernet Merlot 2017
Description: Hawkes Bay is Bordeaux twenty years ago – cool, coastal and producing wines like this rich, red fruity and fresh Cabernet-Merlot blend.
The flagship of one of Spain's very best winemaking estates.

BottleName: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia 'Macán' 2015, Rioja
Parcel Series Central Otago Pinot Noir 2019/20, New Zealand
Description: Herbaceous and spicy, with blackberry and plum notes. It’ll partner beautifully with rack of lamb.

BottleName: Hewitson '66 Seppeltsfield Road' Shiraz-Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, Barossa
Description: Dean Hewitson is one of the most talented winemakers of his generation.

BottleName: Château La Croix De Gay 2016, Pomerol
Description: Château La Croix-De-Gay is known for consistently producing some of Pomerol's best value wines.

BottleName: Ten Minutes by Tractor 'Down the Hill' Estate Pinot Noir 2017, Mornington Peninsula
Description: Ten Minutes by Tractor shows the best of Pinot Noir from Mornington Peninsula. Full flavours of cranberry and juicy cherry.
Made from local variety Plavac Mali, a relative of Zinfandel, this a deeply flavoured red, chockfull of dark fruit, ripe tannins and sweet spice, thanks to a year in oak.

BottleName: Shaw + Smith Pinot Noir 2019, Adelaide Hills
Description: Started by Michael Hill Smith, the first Australian Master of Wine, and famous winemaking consultant Martin Shaw, Shaw & Smith specialises in cool-climate Australian wines.
An expressive style of Pinotage, the Kraal Bay has a bold fruit character and supple tannins.

BottleName: Howard Park 'Flint Rock' Shiraz 2017, Margaret River
Description: Discover notes of plush red berries, sweet spice and liquorice in this Shiraz. Sublime with duck.
The Bellow's Rock is created by a trio of friends who made their first vintage in a tractor shed less than 20 years ago.

BottleName: Chateau Pre Lalande Cuvee Terracotta Organic 2016
Description: A modern-day claret. Easy drinking. Rich. Rounded. Expect generous blackcurrant, blackberry and plum notes along with silky tannins

BottleName: Château La Tour Figeac 2014, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru Classé
Description: A plush, smooth Grand Cru Classé Saint-Émilion made between two prestigious estates.
Just 6,000 bottles of the 'Marinaia' were produced in the exceptional 2016 vintage. It's full-bodied, with ripe notes of dark plum, cedar and dried herbs. James Suckling gave it 91 points.
This is a classic expression of the style from a fantastic vintage. It has excellent aromas of violets, cherry, rose and menthol now - but it'll develop wonderful black-fruit flavour over time.
Grant Burge's flagship Shiraz is less about overt oak and more about exhilarating fruit. Expect layers of blackberry, mulberry and dark chocolate.
This 'Very Special Vineyard' Shiraz shows notes of blackberry, dark chocolate and spice. Serve with braised beef.
A juicy, spicy Fitou made by one of the biggest names in the Languedoc.
When many people imagine their dream claret, they're thinking of Pauillac. This offering from Fifth Growth Château Pédesclau has mouth-coating notes of forest fruits, cedar and cigar box.

BottleName: St Hallett 'Old Block' Shiraz 2016, Barossa Valley
Description: Led by winemaker Helen McCarthy, St Hallett draws inspiration from the climatic diversity in the Barossa Valley. To qualify for their coveted Old Block wine, vines must be 40 years or older. Expect intense flavours of dark fruit. Divine with lamb ribs.

BottleName: Domaine Pardon et Fils 'À Nous' Beaujolais Nouveau 2021
Description: Light, elegant, full of strawberry, blueberry and redcurrant and a real treat with a ham quiche.
Full-bodied and full of black-fruit notes. Pair it with red meat, rich game dishes or robust cheeses.
An elegant, light red wine made on Europe's most active volcano.
A Burgundy-style Pinot that usually sells for three times the price.

BottleName: El Chaparral de Vega Sindoa Garnacha 2018, Navarra
Description: As seen on TV. The wine displays intense, vibrant and fleshy blackberry and raspberry fruit, and ample tannins that add texture and a streak of bitter chocolate flavour.
Bold. Ripe. Fruity. Plush Malbec from the first South American winemaker ever to be named ‘Decanter’s Man of the Year’, Nicolás Catena.
Concentrated notes of blueberries, plum, redcurrants and oaky spice that are great with braised ribs.
Flavours of strawberry, red cherry and blackcurrant. Fantastic lightly chilled with white meats.

BottleName: Domaine de la Cotelleraie 2020 Organic, Saint Nicolas de Bourgeuil AOP
Description: Cabernet Franc is the Loire Valley's star grape. And this is a prime example. Expect note of red fruit and violets. Pair with peppery charcuterie.
Full-bodied and plush, with notes of blackcurrant, blueberry, cocoa and fresh tobacco and a long, smooth finish. Try it with a cassoulet.
Expect flavours of strawberry, raspberry and red cherry, with hints of nutmeg and spice. Partner with Coq au Vin.

BottleName: Edouard Delaunay Pinot Noir 2019, Hautes-Côtes de Nuits
Description: Aromas of bramble fruit, raspberry and cherry, with fragrant hints of wild herbs. Partner with brie.
Rich and ripe, with notes of cocoa, coffee and oak. Try it with roast duck and cabbage.
Seriously jammy and fresh Cabernet. Expect ripe blackberry and black cherry flavours, with hints of smoke and baking spices. Try it with a pork and smoked bacon cassoulet.
Fresh flavours of blueberry, blackberry, cassis and violet that are a prime match for South American-style steak.
Expect notes of ripe red fruits, rose petals and mocha. Try it with chargrilled meats and rich cheeses.

BottleName: Bodegas Fabre 'Alta Yarí Gran Corte' 2019, Gualtallary
Description: Expect flavours of raspberry, vanilla and sweet spices. It's amazingly complex with a zippy acidity that's ideal with braised beef.
Our mission was to find the best tasting wines at £5.99. The Shiraz is full of dark fruits and subtle spiciness - perfect for the arrival of BBQ season.
''Corpulence, medium to full-bodied personality, low acidity, attractive silkiness, and copious quantities of herb-tinged cassis fruit have always made this wine a winner.''. Robert Parker.
It's fruity, approachable and jam-packed with clean, ripe red fruits, a touch of earthy spice and a satin-soft mouthfeel.
The extra years of cellaring has given flavours of plum and blackberry a silky texture that's rounded by supple tannins. The perfect choice for roast beef.
A blend of Italian and international grapes with lively notes of red fruits and spices.
Expect flavours of ripe red fruits and spices, soft tannins, a refreshing acidity and a very long finish. Try it with grilled beef or a hearty stew.
Remarkably complex, with aromas of cherry, vanilla, mint and white pepper. Serve with a no-holds-barred special occasion meal: filet mignon with black truffle, for example.

BottleName: Domaine de Sainte Rose 'Le Pinacle' Syrah 2018, Languedoc
Description: Expect intense notes of black fruits, coffee and dark chocolate that are great with duck.

BottleName: La Rioja Alta ‘904’ Rioja Gran Reserva 2011
Description: It has complex aromas of blackberry jam, raspberries, cedar and cigar box, with liquorice and clove flavours. Thanks to its maturity, it’s perfect for roasted meats.

BottleName: Pétalos Bierzo 2015 Descendientes de J. Palacios
Description: One of 9 children of the owner of Rioja house Bodegas Palacios Remondo, Alvaro Palacio has broken away from Rioja to pursue an independent winemaking philosophy.
Smooth and bursting with black fruits, this is everything a young Rioja has but the region-based label.
We asked our store managers to select and new wine to be stocked nation wide.  After an extensive tasting this was the wine they chose.

BottleName: Escarpment Te Rehua Pinot Noir 2016, Martinborough
Description: Grown on the same gravel terraces as Kiwa, though in a far more sheltered spot. It's as pure an expression of the terroir as you'd find in any Burgundy
This wine is a classic blend of Bordeaux varieties with classic flavours of cassis and dark cherry.

BottleName: Domaine des Lagunes La Côte Rêvée, France
Description: A sophisticated red with notes of blackcurrant and liquorice with a fresh finish.
It has aromas of crushed strawberries and vanilla and fine, elegant tannins. It’ll pair a treat with charcuterie or grilled pork
Created by a star of the Rhône Valley, this emits countless notes of bramble, garrigue herbs and a hint of pepper.
It's from a famous estate with 90+ Parker-Point scores, and praise from Wine Advocate for "excellent" wines and "well judged" winemaking.

BottleName: Riccitelli 'Viñas Viejas en Pie Franco' Malbec 2016, Luján de Cuyo
Description: An exceptional Malbec made by one of Mendoza's most exciting young winemakers. Plenty of black fruits.
Taste the rewards in a ripe palate of plum, blackcurrant, sweet spices and violet.
Over 200 years later, the 'Faith' pays homage to their determination in the now world-famous region. Expect rich mulberry and dark plum notes with aromas of spice on the finish.

BottleName: Work of Time Bordeaux Blend 2012, South Africa
Description: It's aged in oak for 2 years, laid in the bottle for 4 - and if you wait for another 10, its dark-berry, cedar and liquorice-dominated palate will become even more complex.

BottleName: Azuda Syrah 2017 Clos de Luz, Almahue Valley
Description: Clos de Luz is a family winery located in Almahue Valley, known as the birthplace of Carménère in Chile.

BottleName: Ch La Mission Lalande de Pomerol 2007
Description: Lalande-de-Pomerol is the capital of great value claret. From a tiny 2-hectare vineyard of 40-year-old vines, this one has matured deliciously.

BottleName: Sancerre Rouge "Les Bonnes Bouches" 2018, Henri Bourgeois
Description: Morello cherry. Violet. Oak spice. A Sancerre Rouge that's sure to please fans of red Burgundy.
This 22-year-old Tuscan red, dominated by Sangiovese, is initially aged in large oak barrels
It's bundles of red and black fruit, fresh tobacco notes and cedar aromas are released by smooth tannins.

BottleName: Te Mata Estate Cabernet/Merlot 2018, Hawke's Bay
Description: Rich and fruit-forward. Old World technique meets New World flavour for this New Zealand Cabernet blend. Ideal for ageing.
Outstanding, balanced Cabernet Sauvignon is blended with Merlot to craft a plush, rounded palate with notes of blackberry, elderberry and toasty oak and fine-grain tannins.
Smooth yet developed and powerful. This Grand Vin hails from a prestigious Margaux estate.
Château Saint-Roch has been producing wine for centuries.
The Most Wanted Zinfandel is grown in Lodi, in California's Central Valley, which is renowned for Zinfandel wines.
A fresh, vibrant, great-value red Burgundy.
Elegant and linear, it has bright red fruits, a touch of forest floor and hints of oak spice.
If you're looking for old vines then you've come to the right place.
Kloovenburg may be the oldest estate in Swartland, but owner Pieter du Doit is tearing up the rulebook, creating innovative blends with lesser-known grape varieties.
A smooth, straightforward Merlot with smooth tannins, a full body and ripe notes of blackberries, chocolate and vanilla. Pair it with pasta, risotto and red meat.

BottleName: Parcel Series Cabernet Sauvignon 2017, Napa Valley
Description: Rich and smooth with supple tannins, it has bold flavours of black cherry, plum and spices. Try it with rich red meat dishes or portobello mushrooms.
In this wine, Peter Lehmann highlights this outstanding fruit in a subtle yet powerful drink. Expect notes of raspberries, cherries and pepper.

BottleName: Domaine de Galuval 'Terre des Créations' 2016, Côtes du Rhône Villages
Description: Côtes du Rhône Villages is a step above Côtes du Rhône wines.
Enjoy a powerful nose of dark fruits and garrigue herbs, along with gentle rose aromas.
Château Bertrand-Braneyre is made less than ten minutes' drive from 'First Growth' Châteaux Lafite and Mouton Rothschild. Expect ripe black fruits, licorice, silky tannins and a rich, long finish.
Sustainably made, berry-fruity Pinot Noir from the Central Coast, fast becoming California’s Pinot hotspot. Smooth. Silky. Concentrated.
Folklore Mencia is from a Bierzo. It's made from old-vine Mencía, a grape indigenous to this small region that's Spain's answer to Gamay (best known for Beaujolais).

BottleName: Dominio de Morfeo Old Vine Tempranillo 2014, Toro
Description: Aged for two years in oak and three in the bottle, it's a rich, full-bodied red with notes of black fruits, hints of vanilla and softened tannins.

BottleName: Grant Burge 'The Holy Trinity' 2018, Barossa Valley
Description: The Holy Trinity: Grenache, Shiraz and Mourvèdre from old vines in the Barossa Valley. Soft, silky and bursting with red fruit and spice.
Rich and layered Cabernet made by a winemaking legend of the Colchagua Valley.
Xinomavro is like Pinot Noir meets Barbaresco, with an excellent ability to age. Apostolos Thymiopoulos is the master of the grape. And he's exceeded expectations with this.
Château Batailley is an estate that doesn't rest on its laurels. From 1855 to the present day, their wines continue to be a favourite among critics.
The Syrah grape is one of the best-loved in South Africa, and for good reason.
One for the Shiraz enthusiasts, this is big, brooding and full of fragrant black pepper spice, dark fruits and mocha.
Expect complex notes of red berries. Pair with rich tomato pasta.
Sleek. Full of black fruits. An excellent vintage from one of Châteauneuf-du-Pape's finest estates.
St Hallet has grown to be one of the most respected Australian wineries. Expect notes of black forest fruit. Pair with roast lamb.
Rich and intense, with notes of red fruit and oak. Try this with a roast dinner.
Taste 11 years of ageing in this fine and well-structured wine. Expect notes of black fruit and spice. Drink with lasagna.
Can’t find a bargain in Bordeaux? How about this wine from Pomerol, the smallest appellation in the region? A real insider find – it won’t fail to wow you.
A smooth, delicate and citrussy Chardonnay made in a fiercely independent way in some of Beaujolais’ top vineyards.
This is a bright, easy-going Rioja with fresh notes of red fruit and hints of blackberry on the finish. Try it with a roast dinner.
Te Mata make Coleraine from the finest grapes on their oldest vineyards.
Blackcurrant. Thyme. Chocolate. Charming and delicate organic wine from 'the jewel of Minervois'.
The cream-of-the-crop Shiraz from the world-famous Hardys winery.
Intense and rich wine from a pioneering winery in the Ribera del Duero.

BottleName: Wynns Coonawarra Estate 'Black Label' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018/19, Coonawarra
Description: Flavours of dark cherry, lavender and mint that are great with fish tacos.

BottleName: Robert Oatley 'Signature Series' Cabernet Sauvignon 2018, Margaret River
Description: A great-value Margaret River Cabernet. Elegant black-fruit flavour and ripe tannins.
Expect a ripe, fruity red with flavours of black plums, red berries and fragrant herbs. A fantastic match for rich roast chicken.
Tobacco, cedar and chocolate flavours, plus fine tannins, make it a superb match for beef, lamb or game.

BottleName: Bodegas Riojanas 'Viña Albina' Rioja Gran Reserva 2001
Description: Gloriously indulgent flavours of dried red fruit, cocoa, maple and brown sugar that are great with game birds.
This is a complex and fruity wine with ripe berry flavours, fresh acidity, silky tannins and a long persistent finish.
Expect notes of strawberry and liquorice and soft tannins that are great with tapas or medium cheeses.

BottleName: Mayu 'Titon Vineyard' Syrah Gran Reserva 2017, Chile
Description: It’s rich and silky with intense notes of ripe red fruit, spice and vanilla. Enjoy it with grilled lamb and hearty vegetarian dishes.
It not only represents amazing value it is a classic example of Pauillac with intense blackcurrant fruit flavours with fine notes of graphite and cedar.
Showing gorgeous, succulent notes of red and black berry fruit flavours and a warming hint of spiciness. Soft and supple tannins contribute to a long and rounded finish.
Inky, pumping with black fruits and deliciously silky, Nero D'avola's Sicily's answer to Malbec. You're in for buckets of fruit.

BottleName: Allegrini Amarone della Valpolicella Classico DOCG 2016/17
Description: Expect intense notes of ripe dark fruit and spice. Try it with a fillet steak or Italian-style braised beef stew.

BottleName: Château de Pennautier 'Esprit de Pennautier' 2016/17, Cabardès
Description: An intensely aromatic blend of old-vine Syrah with Bordeaux varieties. Expect notes of black fruits, cacao, a hint of mint and elegant tannins. Wonderful with duck in a port and orange jus.

BottleName: Domaine Les Yeuses 'Les Epices' Syrah 2018/19, Languedoc
Description: Wonderfully spicy and perfumed Shiraz, with a soft elegance.
Classic notes of dark cherry and blackcurrant are lifted by a hint of dried flowers and spice. Superbly balanced, the fruits of the forest flavours are perfectly complemented by soft tannins.

BottleName: Ridge East Bench Zinfandel 2018/19, Sonoma County
Description: The palate is layered with dark cherry and black currant fruit, mineral, and cocoa. Balanced acidity with fine tannins on the finish.
On the palate are flavours of dark berry fruits, lifted by the added punch of crushed pink-peppercorns, which are anchored by savoury, gamey undertones.

BottleName: Saint Clair Pioneer Block Pinot Noir 2019/20, Marlborough
Description: Bright ruby in colour, aromas of raspberry and plum are complemented by a touch of spice. A luscious and soft palate with flavours of redcurrant, cherries and an added warmth from time in oak barrels.
Already delicious this will develop further, if you can resist it, for up to 10 years.
Expect concentrated flavours of cassis, black cherries and herbs. Try with a grilled steak.
This is a bold and fruity Pauillac, with flavours of blackcurrant, blackberry, oak, tobacco and cedar. As it's now deliciously mature, it has well-integrated tannins which won't overpower lamb.

BottleName: Le Vassal de Mercues Malbec Cahors 2015/16
Description: Powerful flavours of black cherry, redcurrants and spices will indulge your palate to make every sip more inviting.

One of the best expressions of Barossa Shiraz around, the RWT is aged in French oak, and is fleshier and more opulent than Penfolds Grange. Its rich and full-bodied, with notes of red fruit, spice and black pepper.
Jamie Kutch fled to California to make wine just 14 years ago. But he's already swimming in praise.

BottleName: Napa Family Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon 2017, Napa Valley
Description: To secure you a Napa Valley Cabernet Sauvignon from a prestigious winery at gob-smacking value - we promised to keep the source secret.
Ripe bramble and spicy blackberry notes on the nose are echoed on the richly textured palate, with hints of vanilla oak and balanced acidity on the finish.
Thought you knew juicy Australian wine? This is as rich as they come.
Flavours of dark chocolate, coffee and candied fruits, with a persistent finish. Recommended with grilled red meats, game birds, pulses, stews, seasoned dishes and beef pasties.
A heady blend of Tempranillo and Garnacha, from 30-year-old vines, and aged for three years in American oak barrels, it's one of the finest expressions of Rioja Reserva you're likely to taste.
Torbreck's Runrig Shiraz is blended with a dash of Viognier. So it's reminiscent of a structured, fragrant Côte Rôtie with some added Australian power.
This is a rich and full Malbec, with notes of black fruits and vanilla, and a zippy acidity that's great with steak.

BottleName: Colle Massari Rigoleto Rosso DOC Montecucco Organic 2018
Description: This organic blend, featuring a hefty 70% Sangiovese, is made in Montecucco a stone's throw from Montalcino.
Reminiscent of the finest cru Beaujolais, it has perfumed notes of raspberry and sour cherry, refined minerals and a fresh acidity.
Domaine Gayda, under the advice of Marc Kent, the man behind The Chocolate Block, makes 'En Passant' with different grape varities on different vineyards every year.

BottleName: Château Bel-Orme Tronquoy de Lalande 2006 Magnum, Haut-Médoc
Description: The family behind the wine also owns Château Rauzan-Gassies - a winery recognised as a 'Second Growth' in the legendary 1855 Bordeaux classification.
Trizanne Barnard earned her stripes at the iconic Klein Constantia winery. In 2008, she went her own way.
Château Sénéjac is a prime location for perfectly ripened Cabernet Sauvignon, and the esteemed Cordier family adds dashes of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot.

BottleName: Saint Clair 'Pioneer Block' Cabernet Merlot 2019, Hawkes Bay
Description: For this wine, both the Cabernet Sauvignon and the Merlot grapes were sourced from a single vineyard in Hawkes Bay. Discover notes of plums, blackcurrant and blackberries. Enjoy with slow-cooked beef.
Perigord is an under-the-radar appellation close to Bordeaux. You can find claret doppelgängers here at great value.

BottleName: Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2014 Il Poggione, Italy
Description: Il Poggione is steeped in history. When you try the power, complex and earthy notes of this Brunello - you're sure to agree.
This is the estate's second wine. But it's certainly not second best. Expect intense notes of raspberry and cherry that go excellently with braised lamb.
A great-value red by members of the prestigious Thienpont family in the sunny South of France. It has flavours of cherry, liquorice, tobacco and spice, and a long finish. Pair this with a Cassoulet.

BottleName: Fable Mountain 'The Raptor Post' Red 2017, South Africa
Description: In the rugged slopes of the Witzenberg Mountain range, you'll find leopards hiding, jackal buzzards circling and baboons playing.
Great wine-making runs in the family at this winery. With vineyards in both Bordeaux and Fronsac, their desire to continue their heritage of world-class winemaking remains a constant.
The area is ideal for growing Pinot Noir. In his rendition of this delicate grape, expect fresh flavours and soft tannins. Wonderful with roast chicken.
This Pinotage boasts a palate of fresh red fruits such as strawberries and cranberries.
This is an excellent Super Tuscan that has notes of black fruit, pepper and liquorice and a long finish. Try this with mature cheese.
Château de Sales has been in the hands of the same family since 1464. Expertise has been passed down the generations for over 500 years.
Concentrated. Focused. Spicy. One of the very best wines in the Rhône with a fantastic worldwide reputation.
A plush, smooth Saint-Émilion Grand Cru from an exceptional historic estate.

BottleName: Domaine Faiveley Nuit St Georges 1er Cru
Description: Smooth and spicy. This Pinot Noir has been crafted with precision by a historic Burgundy family.

BottleName: J Vineyards Russian River Valley Pinot Noir 2017
Description: Expect notes of blueberry, raspberry, dark cherry and mushroom. Exquisite with turkey and cranberry sauce.
It has aromas of redcurrant, strawberries and cherries and floral hints of rosebud and lavender. Try it with sausage tagliatelle.

BottleName: E. Guigal Côtes du Rhône Magnum 2017
Description: The Guigal family even make their own barrels to ensure perfection from each vintage. This is full of their signature Syrah blend. Expect notes of red berries and spices. Sublime with cold meats.

BottleName: Jackson Estate Vintage Widow Pinot Noir 2016, Marlborough

Description: Vibrant, silky and flavourful. This wine embodies everything great about Barossa Shiraz, and then some.
An exceptional Tempranillo made by two of the greatest names in wine.
A lush Malbec made by one of South America's most knowledgeable winemakers. Dark fruit. Black pepper.

BottleName: Château de Ferrand Saint-Émilion Grand Cru Magnum 2006
Description: Jammy red fruit notes, supple tannins and gentle hints of spice. Fantastic with a roast dinner.

BottleName: Château Grand Pey Lescours Half Bottle Organic, Saint-Émilion Grand Cru
Description: Velvety notes of black fruits, caramel and sweet spice that are great with hard cheeses.
Expect sumptuous noes of red fruit, woody vanilla and white pepper. This will go wonderfully with duck.
Expect notes of red fruit, vanilla and toast. Try it with roast leg of lamb.
It's rich and cedary, with aromas of violets and red berries and flavours of vanilla and coffee. Try it with roast leg of lamb.

BottleName: Chateau Montelena Estate Cabernet 2016, Napa Valley
Description: It's rich and opulent, with flavours of black plum, blackberry, redcurrant, cinnamon and coffee. Try it with roast lamb.

BottleName: Darling Cellars 'Cape Maidens' Cinsault-Shiraz 2020, South Africa
Description: Think notes of black fruits, tobacco, dark chocolate and black pepper. It has smooth tannins which are great with chicken in a creamy blue-cheese sauce.
Expect elegant notes of cranberry, wild strawberry, cinnamon and baking spices and elegant tannins that are a treat with turkey.
Flavours of bramble fruit, cedar, fresh tobacco and cocoa that are great with a cheese board.
A middleweight claret with a good balance of ripe plum and berry flavours, with plenty of concentration. Tannins are fine-grained and provide a smooth yet ample feel.
Fragrant notes of ripe fruits, violets and cedar with beautiful length and delicate tannins. Great structure, balance and a long finish.
This wine is dark ruby with a complex nose of spices and hints of pear. A smooth and lingering finish.
From arguably the most famous Beaujolais Cru the 2016 is a stunning wine.  The hot summer has added richness and concentration to he bright flavours of cherry and violet.

BottleName: Gianni Brunelli Brunello di Montalcino DOCG 2015/16
Description: This is a concentrated and slightly savoury expression of the Sangiovese grape, with flavours of cherry, wild strawberry, forest floor and tobacco. Decant for an hour before serving with a herby steak of cellar until 2040.
This is powerful and silky smooth, with intense aromas of ripe red and black berries, coffee, and subtle hints of mint and smoky oak.
Aromas of balsamic with outstanding notes of vanilla, chocolate, leather and soft toasted well integrated with ripe fruits and a mineral touch.

BottleName: Marques de Calado Tempranillo 2020 Vino de la Tierra Castilla
Description: Classic Tempranillo notes of dark cherry and blackcurrant are lifted by a hint of dried flowers and spice. Superbly balanced, fruits of the forest flavours are perfectly complemented by soft tannins.
Red berry aromas and flavours are followed by elegant toast from the oak ageing.  Well balanced and harmonious the finish is long and velvety.

This is made from multi-region vineyards, ensuring its ripe, robust character is balanced by freshness. Discover intense aromas of plum and baking spice, with flavours of dark raspberry, chocolate and cola. Partner with seared steak.
From Aurelio Montes, Chile's most decorated winemaker. A heady bouquet of strawberry and blackcurrant meets a decadent slather of vanilla.

BottleName: Saint Clair Estate Selection Pinot Noir 2017, Marlborough
Description: Rich garnet core with a purplish rim. Aromas of ripe black cherries and currants, with a lifted raspberry note and a hint of vanilla. Fine tannins, medium palate weight, and good fruit concentration.
A medium weight red, with a pleasing balance between ripe fruit and savoury, earthy notes on the nose. The palate is succulent and mouth-filling, with lashings of red berry and brambles.

BottleName: Yalumba Y-Series Cabernet Sauvignon 2015 South Australia
Description: Supple and approachable on the palate, with a generous texture.

BottleName: Wirra Wirra 'The Good Catch' Shiraz Cabernet Petit Verdot 2018 South Australia
Description: A brilliant crimson with a purple edge, this is a youthful and vibrant wine offering raspberry, cherry and blackberry fruit, lifted by hints of violet and spicy oak notes.

BottleName: Boekenhoutskloof 'The Chocolate Block' 2019 Magnum, Western Cape
Description: An earthy, rustic nose gives up aromas of leather, earth and spices over a backdrop of blackcurrant and ripe raspberry fruit. Harmonious and powerful on the palate, with a cocoa and pepper complexity.

BottleName: Two Hands 'Lily's Garden' Shiraz 2017/18, McLaren Vale
Description: An intoxicating perfume of hot stones, North African spices, leather and dried fuit leads to a palate of incredible richness, concentration and purity.
''Intensely scented of warm black plums, black cherry compote,,, Full bodied, densely packed and generously layered with ripe berry flavors,,,''. 95 points. Lisa Perrotti-Brown Wine Advocate.
Big, expressive and rich with a nuttiness in the mouth, it finishes very long and very sweet.''
The Saint Georges Pinot Noir is elegant and perfumed. It has notes of violets and raspberry that are balanced by refreshing acidity.
You might think that Australia's too warm for the demanding Pinot Noir grape.
Te Mata is one of New Zealand's top wineries. It's the best in Hawke's Bay.
A Bordeaux from the perfect 5/5 2010 vintage (maybe even vintage of the century!) at this low price?
Incredible value aged claret from the maker of a Second Growth. Savoury. Spicey. It’s got flavours of ripe cherry and a lovely silky texture.
It's full-bodied and smooth, with juicy red-fruit flavours and rich tannins. Try it now duck breast.
Ethereal and velvety. This under-the-radar Montalcino winery offers the opportunity to get your hands on some affordable Brunello.
Made from old vines in the coastal area of Fitou this is a powerful and fruity wine with flavours of brambles, plum, rosemary and thyme.
Spending just a short period of time in cask, this has juicy red fruits at its forefront. Its deep-violet hues release lip-smacking tannins and fresh acidity.
The grapes are captured at perfect ripeness - encouraging the deep blackberry and soft liquorice flavours showcased through each supple sip.
Classic and powerful Zinfandel. Discover complex notes of spicy wood, raspberry compote and liquorice.
The wines come from selected parcels of old vines, and are made with a minimalist approach, including fermentation by natural yeasts,  for a classically elegant, sweet and savoury structure.
Bob Linquist has a lifetime award for creating Rhône-style wines in California. This Syrah is an exceptional case in point.
Aloxe-Corton produces some of Burgundy's finest Pinot Noir.

BottleName: Santenay 'Vieilles Vignes' Rouge 2017/18 Girardin Père et Fils, Burgundy
Description: This Pinot Noir is made from 45-year-old vines in Santenay, the village in which the founder of the winery, Vincent Girardin, was born.

BottleName: Côtes-du-Rhône Villages Laudun 2017 Château Courac, France
Description: Château Courac has been in winemaker Frederic Arnaud's family since 1641. He makes this blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and rare Counoise from 45-year-old vines.

BottleName: Chorey-les-Beaune 'Vieilles Vignes' 2019/20 Domaine Machard de Gramont
Description: Domaine Marchard de Gramont picks every Pinot Noir grape by hand before it ages this light, smooth Pinot Noir in its 11th-century cellar for up to 14 months in both French and American oak.

BottleName: Cassagnes Nerthe Organic Cotes du Rhone Villages 2018
Description: With records dating back to 1560, Château la Nerthe is one of the Rhône's oldest producers and renowned for Châteauneuf-du-Pape.

BottleName: Broc Cellars Love Red Blend 2018, California
Description: Another natural wine at Majestic and this one is a real gem. Made by the innovative Californian Broc Cellars, this is a unique blend of Carignan, Valdiguié and Petite Sirah.

BottleName: Côte-Rôtie 'Ampodium' 2017 Domaine Rene Rostaing, Rhône Valley
Description: Pierre Rostaing makes some of the Rhône's most desired wines.

BottleName: Rioja Crianza 'Edición Limitada' 2016 Marqués del Átrio, Spain
Description: Made from Tempranillo and Graciano vines that are, on average, 25-years-old and aged for up to 14 months in oak, this Crianza is a ripe, fruity Rioja.
Don David Malbec is produced from high altitude vines in Argentina's Salta region.

BottleName: Pierre Gaillard Domaine Madeloc 'Cuvée Serral' 2017, Collioure
Description: One of the most prestigious family names in the Rhône Valley has taken to the Côte Rôtie-like soils close to the Spanish border.

BottleName: Parcel Series Old Vine Zinfandel 2018, California
Description: This release was produced by one of the fastest growing family-owned wineries in the USA. It's full-bodied, and filled with dark fruit, vanilla and spice. Partner with winter-perfect rich beef stews.

BottleName: Château Vieux Rivallon Grand Cru St Emilion 2004
Description: It has aromas of vanilla and cedar, integrated tannins, flavours of red fruit and cocoa and an excellent length. Pair this with rich meats or cheese on a winter evening.

BottleName: Domaine des Tourelles Old Vine Cinsault 2018, Beqaa Valley
Description: This is a supple, exotic wine with aromas of fig, red cherry, and plum and a palate of ripe red fruits and spice. Pair it with a hearty stew.
This Shiraz has notes of blackberry and plum, velvety tannins and a hint of oak. Top US critic James Suckling gave it 91 points. Try it with a burger.
This wine is concentrated, elegant and structured, with notes of blackberry, cherry, white pepper and ground herbs. Pair this with a roast leg of lamb.
Made solely from the Filsell vineyard of near century old vines, this Shiraz has notes of coffee bean, vanilla and blackberry.

BottleName: Colle Massari 'Grattamacco 35th Anniversary' Bolgheri Superiore 2017, Organic
Description: Elegant and truly unique. This is a special edition of an iconic Cabernet blend from the Bolgheri region.
It's full-bodied and savoury, with notes of blackberry, blueberry, white pepper and olive. Wine Enthusiast gave it 95 points. Try it with lamb or grilled beef.
Expect flavours of red cherry, plum and oregano and a vibrant, fresh acidity which pairs excellently with rib-eye steak.

BottleName: Cloudy Bay Pinot Noir 2014 Magnum, Marlborough
Description: Cloudy Bay say the 2014 vintage was their best Pinot Noir to date - and now there's twice as much of it. This is fresh, structured and complex.
It has soft aromas of red fruit and fresh flowers, and plenty of acidity and minerality. Try it with pork shoulder tacos or curry.
A South African classic. This Bordeaux blend is complex and ripe and will age excellently for 20 years.
Expect a poised red with aromas of cherry, strawberry and chocolate.
A fantastic value Margaux made by a family who also own a Grand Cru Classé estate.

BottleName: Mt Difficulty 'Ghost Town' Pinot Noir 2016, Central Otago
Description: Plush, dark and fruity. Made from grapes at 340 metres above sea level, this is Central Otago Pinot Noir at its finest.

BottleName: The Bolney Estate Pinor Noir, West Sussex
Description: A vibrant and bright Pinot Noir with hints of red fruits and toasted almonds. Great with pork.
A great-value, developed Saint-Estèphe made by an estate on the up.
A generous, rich Barossa blend from one of Australia's finest winemaking families. A great way to taste their expertise without spending hundreds of pounds.

BottleName: Marqués de Riscal Rioja Reserva Half Bottle
Description: Flavours of summer berries, liquorice and vanilla spice that are perfect with Jamón.
Notes of black fruits, eucalyptus, leather and tobacco that are great lightly chilled with pasta.

BottleName: San Leonino 'Al Limite' Chianti Classico DOCG 2018, Half Bottle
Description: Silky flavours of ripe cherries, violets, tobacco and menthol that will stand up to mature cheeses.
This is a bright yet subtly savoury Pinot Noir, with notes of strawberry, red cherry, earth and mushroom. Try it with duck.

BottleName: Domaine Faiveley 'Les Porêts Saint-Georges' Nuits Saint Georges Premier Cru 2014
Description: Flavours of strawberry, raspberry, toast and oak that are great with duck breast.
It's medium-bodied and rich, with flavours of blueberries, black cherries, blackcurrants and herbs. Try it with a steak.
A restrained, elegant expression of Malbec, with bright aromas, pronounced fruit flavours and smooth tannins. It's aged in oak for four months to add texture and complexity.
Bold and spicy, with notes of blackberry, plum, coffee, vanilla and nutmeg. Try it with pork or hard cheeses.
